Lá»i má»i báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh

Trang trÆ°á»›c
Trang sau Â 

Lá»i má»i trong tiáº¿ng Anh

Trong giao tiáº¿p tiáº¿ng Anh, Ä‘á»ƒ má»i ai Ä‘Ã³ Ä‘i Ä‘Ã¢u, lÃ m gÃ¬ thÃ¬ tÃ¹y theo ngá»¯ cáº£nh trang trá»ng hay thÃ¢n máº­t thÃ¬ báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ lá»±a chá»n lá»i má»i khÃ¡c nhau.

DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t sá»‘ máº«u cÃ¢u Ä‘Æ°á»£c sá»­ dá»¥ng Ä‘á»ƒ lÃ m lá»i má»i trong tiáº¿ng Anh.

- I would like to invite you to a reception next Sunday at my home. (Trang trá»ng)
- I would like to invite you to dinner at the new French restaurant. (Trang trá»ng)
- Would you care to join us for dessert and coffee?
(dessert: mÃ³n trÃ¡ng miá»‡ng)
- Would you like to go to Washington with me next month?
- I was wondering if you'd like to go to the pool on Saturday.
- I was wondering if you'd like to come to dinner on Tuesday evening.

ChÃº Ã½: Khi báº¡n má»Ÿ Ä‘áº§u cÃ¢u "I was wondering if..." báº¡n pháº£i tuÃ¢n theo tráº­t tá»± Chá»§ ngá»¯ rá»“i Ä‘áº¿n Äá»™ng tá»«: you + would like... chá»© khÃ´ng dÃ¹ng theo dáº¡ng cÃ¢u há»i lÃ : Would + you + like...?

NgoÃ i cÃ¡c máº«u cÃ¢u trÃªn, báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ sá»­ dá»¥ng How about ... hoáº·c What about ...:

- Can you meet me at the gym after class for some basketball?
- Will you come over tomorrow night and watch the game with us?
- How about a movie tonight?
- What about a movie tonight?
- How about a quick game of pool before we go home?
- What about a quick game of pool before we go home?
- How about canoeing at the lake tomorow afternoon?
(canoeing: bÆ¡i ca nÃ´)
- What about canoeing at the lake tomorow afternoon?
- How about camping out at Mount Mitchell next weekend?
(camping: cáº¯m tráº¡i)
- What about camping out at Mount Mitchell next weekend?

ChÃº Ã½: Sau "What about...?" hay "How about...?" lÃ  má»™t danh tá»« (a movie, a game) hoáº·c danh Ä‘á»™ng tá»« (canoeing, camping).

NgoÃ i ra, báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ sá»­ dá»¥ng máº«u cÃ¢u báº¯t Ä‘áº§u vá»›i Why not ... hoáº·c Why don't you nhÆ° sau:

- Why not jog with me this afternoon?

YÃªu cáº§u giÃºp Ä‘á»¡ báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh

YÃªu cáº§u giÃºp Ä‘á»¡ báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh

TrÆ°á»ng há»£p cáº¥p bÃ¡ch

Trong nhá»¯ng trÆ°á»ng há»£p tháº­t sá»± cáº¥p bÃ¡ch, chÃºng ta khÃ´ng cÃ²n giá»¯ Ä‘Ãºng phÃ©p lá»‹ch sá»±; chÃºng ta muá»‘n thÃ´ng bÃ¡o cÃ ng nhanh cÃ ng tá»‘t. Giáº£ sá»­ báº¡n Ä‘ang á»Ÿ tráº¡m xe buÃ½t, Ä‘á»™t nhiÃªn ai Ä‘Ã³ giá»±t máº¥t tÃºi xÃ¡ch cá»§a báº¡n vÃ  bá» cháº¡y. Báº¡n cáº§n giÃºp Ä‘á»¡ nÃªn kÃªu cá»©u:

- Help! I've been robbed!
- Help me! Stop that thief!
- Quick! Don't let that man get away! He stole my wallet!
rob (v): cÆ°á»›p, trá»™m
thief (n): tÃªn trá»™m
wallet (n): vÃ­ tiá»n

Nhá»¯ng má»‡nh lá»‡nh nÃ y bÃ¡o hiá»‡u cho nhá»¯ng ngÆ°á»i xung quanh biáº¿t báº¡n cáº§n Ä‘Æ°á»£c giÃºp Ä‘á»¡ tá»©c kháº¯c Ä‘á»ƒ Ä‘uá»•i báº¯t gÃ£ Ä‘ang cháº¡y trá»‘n.

Trong trÆ°á»ng há»£p khÃ¡c, giáº£ sá»­ báº¡n Ä‘ang ngá»“i trong nhÃ  hÃ ng, Ä‘á»™t nhiÃªn ngÆ°á»i ngá»“i chung bÃ n bá»‹ máº¯c ngháº¹n, thá»Ÿ há»•n há»ƒn. Anh áº¥y ra dáº¥u bá»‹ ngháº¹t thá»Ÿ. Báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ yÃªu cáº§u Ä‘Æ°á»£c giÃºp Ä‘á»¡ báº±ng cÃ¡ch la to:

- Help! He's choking! Does anyone know the Heimlich maneuver?

Heimlich maneuver: lÃ  má»™t ká»¹ thuáº­t tiáº¿p sá»©c Ä‘áº§u tiÃªn Ä‘Æ°á»£c dÃ¹ng Ä‘á»ƒ tiáº¿p sá»©c
cho cÃ¡c náº¡n nhÃ¢n bá»‹ ngá»™p thá»Ÿ. NÃ³ Ä‘Æ°á»£c Ä‘áº·t tÃªn theo vá»‹ bÃ¡c sÄ© Ä‘Ã£ sÃ¡ng cháº¿ ra nÃ³.
emergency (n): tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng kháº©n cáº¥p

May máº¯n lÃ  cáº£ hai trÆ°á»ng há»£p trÃªn hiáº¿m khi xáº£y ra má»—i ngÃ y. NhÆ°ng cÅ©ng cáº§n nÃªn biáº¿t qua Ä‘á»ƒ náº¿u cáº§n, báº¡n biáº¿t sáº½ pháº£i yÃªu cáº§u Ä‘Æ°á»£c giÃºp Ä‘á»¡ kháº©n cáº¥p nhÆ° tháº¿ nÃ o. YÃªu cáº§u pháº£i tháº­t rÃµ rÃ ng vÃ  trá»±c tiáº¿p trong hoÃ n cáº£nh cáº¥p bÃ¡ch, bá»Ÿi vÃ¬ hÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng nhanh chÃ³ng cá»±c ká»³ quan trá»ng.

TrÆ°á»ng há»£p khÃ´ng cáº¥p bÃ¡ch

Náº¿u tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng khÃ´ng nguy hiá»ƒm Ä‘Ã²i há»i pháº£i hÃ nh Ä‘á»™ng kháº©n cáº¥p, chÃºng ta cÃ³ thá»ƒ nhá» giÃºp Ä‘á»¡ má»™t cÃ¡ch bÃ¬nh tÄ©nh hÆ¡n vÃ  lá»‹ch sá»± hÆ¡n. VÃ­ dá»¥, báº¡n cáº§n ngÆ°á»i mang phá»¥ má»™t cÃ¡i há»™p náº·ng ra xe. Báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ nÃ³i vá»›i ngÆ°á»i báº¡n cÃ¹ng phÃ²ng:

Hoáº·c náº¿u báº¡n Ä‘ang gáº·p ráº¯c rá»‘i vá» pháº§n tá»« vá»±ng cá»§a má»™t bÃ i Ä‘á»c, báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ há»i:

some trouble understanding all these words

DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t vÃ i cÃ¡ch phá»• biáº¿n Ä‘á»ƒ báº¯t Ä‘áº§u yÃªu cáº§u Ä‘Æ°á»£c giÃºp Ä‘á»¡. Báº¡n cáº§n lÆ°u Ã½ cÃ¡ch sá»­ dá»¥ng cÃ¡c Ä‘á»™ng tá»« khiáº¿m khuyáº¿t (would, coud, can, will) trong nhá»¯ng vÃ­ dá»¥ sau:

- If it's not too much trouble, could you...?
- Could I impose on you to...?
- Could I ask you a favor? Would you...?
- I hope you don't mind, but could...?
- Would you mind helping me?
- Would you mind doing something for me?
- I have a favor to ask. Would you...?
- Could/Would/Can/Will you help me?
- Could/Would/Can/Will you lend me a hand?
- How about assisting me with...?
impose on (v): lá»£i dá»¥ng, nhá», ...

Báº¡n Ä‘Ã£ tá»«ng Ä‘á» nghá»‹ giÃºp Ä‘á»¡ ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c chÆ°a. VÃ  cÃ¡ch thá»ƒ hiá»‡n báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh nhÆ° tháº¿ nÃ o. Má»i báº¡n tiáº¿p tá»¥c theo dÃµi chÆ°Æ¡ng tiáº¿p theo.

ChÃ o táº¡m biá»‡t báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh (Pháº§n 1)

Trong tiáº¿ng Anh cÃ³ nhiá»u cÃ¡ch chÃ o táº¡m biá»‡t tÃ¹y theo tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng sáº¯p xáº£y ra. NhÆ°ng cÃ³ má»™t qui táº¯c mÃ  báº¡n cáº§n pháº£i tuÃ¢n thá»§ trong má»i trÆ°á»ng há»£p, Ä‘Ã³ lÃ  Ã­t khi nÃ o ngÆ°á»i ta táº¡m biá»‡t má»™t cÃ¡ch thÃ´ lá»—.

Báº¡n pháº£i nÃ³i má»™t cÃ¢u gÃ¬ Ä‘Ã³ cÃ³ tÃ­nh xÃ£ giao vÃ  lÃ m vui lÃ²ng ngÆ°á»i nghe trÆ°á»›c khi chuáº©n bá»‹ ra vá», cháº³ng háº¡n:

- I've really enjoyed talking to you.
TÃ´i thá»±c sá»± thÃ­ch nÃ³i chuyá»‡n vá»›i báº¡n.

hoáº·c má»™t cÃ¢u gÃ¬ Ä‘Ã³ nháº¯c Ä‘áº¿n thá»i gian nhÆ°:

- Gosh, I can't believe how late it is! I really must be going.
Chao Ã´i, khÃ´ng thá»ƒ tin lÃ  Ä‘Ã£ muá»™n Ä‘áº¿n tháº¿. MÃ¬nh thá»±c sá»± pháº£i Ä‘i rá»“i.

A. CÃ¡c cÃ¢u nÃ³i thÃ´ng dá»¥ng trÆ°á»›c khi chÃ o táº¡m biá»‡t

TrÆ°á»›c khi chÃ o Goodbye vÃ  sau Ä‘Ã³ ra vá», báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ nÃ³i má»™t sá»‘ cÃ¢u tiáº¿ng Anh thÃ´ng dá»¥ng sau:

Nhá»¯ng cÃ¢u mang tÃ­nh xÃ£ giao (Pleasantries)

- I've enjoyed meeting you.
- I've enjoyed talking to you.
- I've enjoyed seeing you.
- It's been good seeing you again.
- It was nice talking to you.
- I'm glad I ran into you.

Trong Ä‘Ã³:

  • Pleasantries lÃ  nhá»¯ng cÃ¢u nÃ³i nháº¹ nhÃ ng dÃ¹ng Ä‘á»ƒ má»Ÿ Ä‘áº§u vÃ  káº¿t thÃºc má»™t cuá»™c nÃ³i chuyá»‡n hay chÃ o há»i.

  • LÆ°u Ã½ ráº±ng cÃ³ má»™t sá»± khÃ¡c biá»‡t lá»›n giá»¯a meeting vÃ  talking to.

    ChÃºng ta nÃ³i: "I've enjoyed meeting you" sau khi chÃºng ta Ä‘Æ°á»£c giá»›i thiá»‡u vá»›i ngÆ°á»i nÃ o Ä‘Ã³ láº§n Ä‘áº§u.

    Vá»›i ngÆ°á»i mÃ  chÃºng ta Ä‘Ã£ quen biáº¿t, thÃ¬ nÃ³i: "I've enjoyed talking to (hoáº·c seeing ) you."

  • Ran into (trong trÆ°á»ng há»£p nÃ y) lÃ  má»™t thÃ nh ngá»¯, cÃ³ nghÄ©a "met by accident" = tÃ¬nh cá» gáº·p nhau, ngáº«u nhiÃªn gáº·p nhau.

Nhá»¯ng cÃ¢u mang ngá»¥ Ã½ thá»i gian

- I'd better be going. It's almost... (thá»i gian)
- Well, it's getting late. I've got to run/go/hurry.
- Look at the time! I've really got to go!
- I should be going. It's getting late, and I have a lot to do.
- Where has the time gone? I guess I'd better be running along.

Náº¿u khi chÃ o táº¡m biá»‡t, báº¡n mong muá»‘n Ä‘Æ°á»£c giá»¯ liÃªn láº¡c vá»›i ngÆ°á»i kia, báº¡n cáº§n nÃ³i nhÆ° tháº¿ nÃ o? Má»i báº¡n tiáº¿p tá»¥c theo dÃµi chÆ°Æ¡ng tiáº¿p theo.

Lá»i cáº£m Æ¡n trong báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh

NÃ³i lá»i cÃ¡m Æ¡n khi Ä‘Æ°á»£c giÃºp Ä‘á»¡ lÃ  má»™t pháº§n quan trá»ng trong má»—i ná»n vÄƒn hÃ³a. ChÃºng ta cÃ¡m Æ¡n vÃ¬ nhiá»u thá»©, nhÆ° khi nháº­n Ä‘Æ°á»£c tin tá»©c, Ä‘Æ°á»£c má»i, nháº­n quÃ , Ä‘Æ°á»£c giÃºp Ä‘á»¡ hoáº·c khi nhá» cáº­y ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c vÃ  khi Ä‘Æ°á»£c khen.

ChÃºng ta bÃ y tá» lÃ²ng biáº¿t Æ¡n dÆ°á»›i nhiá»u hÃ¬nh thá»©c khÃ¡c nhau, tá»« nhá»¯ng cÃ¢u ráº¥t Ä‘Æ¡n giáº£n nhÆ° "Thanks" hoáº·c "Thank you" Ä‘áº¿n nhá»¯ng cÃ¢u phá»©c táº¡p vÃ  trá»‹nh trá»ng hÆ¡n "Thank you ever so much for..." hoáº·c "You have no idea how grateful I am for..."

Sá»± chÃ¢n tháº­t vÃ  giá»ng nÃ³i lÃ  hai pháº§n quan trá»ng trong lÃºc cÃ¡m Æ¡n. NgÆ°á»i nghe pháº£i cáº£m nháº­n Ä‘Æ°á»£c sá»± biáº¿t Æ¡n chÃ¢n tháº­t qua nhá»¯ng gÃ¬ báº¡n nÃ³i. VÃ¬ váº­y náº¿u báº¡n chá»‰ cÃ³ thá»ƒ nÃ³i nhá»¯ng cÃ¢u cáº£m Æ¡n ráº¥t má»™c máº¡c chá»‰ vá»›i vÃ i tá»« nhÆ°ng báº±ng giá»ng nÃ³i nhiá»‡t thÃ nh vÃ  ná»¥ cÆ°á»i tháº­t tÆ°Æ¡i â€” chá»‰ váº­y thÃ´i lÃ  há» Ä‘á»§ biáº¿t Ä‘Æ°á»£c thÃ nh tÃ¢m cá»§a báº¡n rá»“i.

ÄÃ¡p láº¡i lá»i cáº£m Æ¡n báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh

Sau khi nháº­n Ä‘Æ°á»£c lá»i cÃ¡m Æ¡n, thÃ´ng thÆ°á»ng ngÆ°á»i ta Ä‘Ã¡p láº¡i Ä‘Æ¡n giáº£n báº±ng cÃ¢u: "You're welcome". NhÆ°ng cÅ©ng cÃ³ má»™t sá»‘ cÃ¡ch tráº£ lá»i khÃ¡c nhÆ°:

- It was my pleasure. (Trang trá»ng)
- You're welcome. (Trang trá»ng)
- You're very welcome. (Trang trá»ng)
- You're more than welcome. (Trang trá»ng)
- Oh, it was the least I could do.
- Think nothing of it.
- It was nothing.
- My pleasure.
- Don't mention it.
- Any time. (ThÃ¢n máº­t)
- No big deal. (ThÃ¢n máº­t)

Lá»i cáº£m Æ¡n khi Ä‘Æ°á»£c cung cáº¥p thÃ´ng tin hoáº·c chá»‰ dáº«n

CÃ¡c cuá»™c há»™i thoáº¡i dÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y minh há»a cÃ¡ch nÃ³i lá»i cáº£m Æ¡n báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh trong trÆ°á»ng há»£p báº¡n cáº£m Æ¡n ai Ä‘Ã³ Ä‘Ã£ cung cáº¥p thÃ´ng tin hoáº·c hÆ°á»›ng dáº«n cho báº¡n.

1.
A:	I want to thank you so much for the map and directions. You have no idea
what a tremendous help you've been! (Trang trá»ng)
B:	It was my pleasure. (Trang trá»ng)
2.
A:	Thank you for all your help. I think I can find my way now.
B:	You're welcome. Good luck.
3.
A: 	Thanks a lot for the information. I really appreciate it.
B: 	Oh, you're very welcome. Any time.
4.
A:	Thanks for taking the time to explain it to me. I hope it wasn't too
much of a bother.
B:	Not at all. It was the least I could do.
5.
A: 	Thanks a million for the info. (ThÃ¢n máº­t)
B:	You bet! Any time. (ThÃ¢n máº­t)

Sáºµn lÃ²ng giÃºp Ä‘á»¡ trong tiáº¿ng Anh

á»¨ng phÃ³ lá»i Than phiá»n trong tiáº¿ng Anh

Cháº¯c báº¡n Ä‘Ã£ tá»«ng nghe "KhÃ¡ch hÃ ng lÃ  thÆ°á»£ng Ä‘áº¿", vÃ  do Ä‘Ã³ "KhÃ¡ch hÃ ng lÃºc nÃ o cÅ©ng Ä‘Ãºng". VÃ¬ váº­y, khi má»™t ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡ch phÃ n nÃ n mÃ³n khoai tÃ¢y cá»§a anh ta chÆ°a chÃ­n, anh bá»“i nÃªn tráº£ lá»i:

- You didn't cut my hair short enough last time in the back.

Lá»i Ä‘Ã¡p trong giao tiáº¿p tiáº¿ng Anh

Trang trÆ°á»›c
Trang sau Â 

CÃ¡c lá»i Ä‘Ã¡p thÃ´ng dá»¥ng trong giao tiáº¿p tiáº¿ng Anh

DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t sá»‘ lá»i Ä‘Ã¡p thÃ´ng dá»¥ng trong giao tiáº¿p tiáº¿ng Anh:

- I'm doing very well, thank you. And you? (Trang trá»ng)
- I'm fine, thank you.
- Fine. How are you?
- Great, thanks. What about you?
- Couldn't be better! Yourself?
- Not bad. You?
- Okay, I guess. You doing all right?
- Can't complain. How about you?
- Lousy! (ThÃ¢n máº­t)
- Fantastic! (ThÃ¢n máº­t)

Trong Ä‘Ã³:

  • And you? hay You? cÃ³ nghÄ©a lÃ  "And how are you doing?". NÃªn lá»‹ch sá»± há»i vá» ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c sau khi chÃºng ta Ä‘Ã£ Ä‘Ã¡p láº¡i lá»i chÃ o.

  • Couldn't be better cÃ³ nghÄ©a lÃ  "I couldn't be better" hoáº·c "Things in my life couldn't be better".

  • You doing all right? cÃ³ nghÄ©a lÃ  "Are you doing all right?"

  • Can't complain cÃ³ nghÄ©a lÃ  "I can't complain".

Ba cÃ¢u Ä‘Ã¡p cuá»‘i cÃ¹ng nÃ y lÃ  nhá»¯ng vÃ­ dá»¥ vá» sá»± tÄ©nh lÆ°á»£c. TÄ©nh lÆ°á»£c hay rÃºt ngáº¯n nhá»¯ng má»‡nh Ä‘á» hay cÃ¢u há»i lÃ  bá» bá»›t má»™t tá»« hay má»™t cá»¥m tá»« Ä‘Ã£ trá»Ÿ nÃªn phá»• thÃ´ng trong trÃ² chuyá»‡n hÃ ng ngÃ y.

Má»Ÿ Ä‘áº§u: cáº§n phÃ¢n biá»‡t giá»¯a má»‡nh lá»‡nh vs yÃªu cáº§u

Trong má»‘i quan há»‡ hÃ ng ngÃ y, chÃºng ta sáº½ tháº¥y ráº±ng cÃ³ lÃºc cáº§n pháº£i yÃªu cáº§u ai Ä‘Ã³ lÃ m giÃºp ta, cháº³ng háº¡n: láº¥y má»™t mÃ³n Ä‘á»“, nhá» váº£ chuyá»‡n nÃ y chuyá»‡n ná» (Ä‘Ã³ng giÃ¹m cá»­a sá»•) hay tháº­m chÃ­ lÃ  Ä‘á»«ng lÃ m chuyá»‡n gÃ¬ Ä‘Ã³ (Ä‘á»«ng nÃ³i chuyá»‡n á»“n Ã o).

Báº¥t ká»ƒ lÃ  trong trÆ°á»ng há»£p nÃ o, Ä‘iá»u cá»‘t yáº¿u lÃ  báº¡n pháº£i phÃ¢n biá»‡t rÃµ rÃ ng giá»¯a má»‡nh lá»‡nh vÃ  lá»i yÃªu cáº§u. Tá»« Ä‘Æ°á»£c dÃ¹ng, cÃ¡ch biá»ƒu Ä‘áº¡t vÃ  giá»ng nÃ³i cÃ³ thá»ƒ táº¡o ra sá»± khÃ¡c biá»‡t ráº¥t lá»›n giá»¯a má»™t má»‡nh lá»‡nh khÃ´ khá»‘c vÃ  má»™t lá»i yÃªu cáº§u lá»‹ch sá»±.

VÃ­ dá»¥: Má»™t bÃ  chá»§ cÃ³ thá»ƒ nÃ³i vá»›i cÃ´ thÆ° kÃ½:

ChÃºng ta thÆ°á»ng nghe tháº¥y nhá»¯ng kiá»ƒu yÃªu cáº§u nÃ y. ChÃºng Ä‘Æ°á»£c phÃ¡t ra tá»« nhá»¯ng ngÆ°á»i cÃ³ quyá»n, má»‡nh lá»‡nh cá»§a há» pháº£i Ä‘Æ°á»£c thi hÃ nh ngay, vÃ  khÃ´ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c phÃ©p tháº¯c máº¯c gÃ¬ cáº£.

Má»—i ngÆ°á»i Ä‘á»u muá»‘n cÃ¹ng má»™t káº¿t quáº£: Ä‘em tá» bÃ¡o Ä‘áº¿n chá»• anh ta.

  • Báº±ng cÃ¡ch thÃªm vÃ o hai tá»« "would you" nhÆ° lÃ  má»™t pháº§n cÃ¢u há»i Ä‘uÃ´i, Sam lÃ m giáº£m bá»›t má»™t Ã­t váº» má»‡nh lá»‡nh trong lá»i yÃªu cáº§u. RÃµ rÃ ng lÃ  anh ta mong muá»‘n báº¡n anh sáº½ tráº£ lá»i "Sure. No problem".

  • Tom thÃ¬ khÃ©o lÃ©o vÃ  lá»‹ch sá»± hÆ¡n khi má»Ÿ Ä‘áº§u cÃ¢u "Would you mind...?" Anh chÃ ng nÃ y ráº¥t quan tÃ¢m Ä‘áº¿n cáº£m giÃ¡c cá»§a ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c, vÃ  cá»¥m tá»« "Would you mind...?" lÃ  má»™t cÃ¡ch nÃ³i an toÃ n, ráº¥t dá»… gÃ¢y cáº£m tÃ¬nh Ä‘á»ƒ báº¯t Ä‘áº§u má»™t lá»i yÃªu cáº§u.

Lá»i yÃªu cáº§u cÅ©ng cÃ³ thá»ƒ Ä‘Æ°á»£c diá»…n Ä‘áº¡t dÆ°á»›i dáº¡ng má»™t cÃ¢u bÃ y tá» Æ°á»›c nguyá»‡n hay Ã½ muá»‘n. VÃ­ dá»¥:

Lá»i yÃªu cáº§u trong cÃ¡c tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng khÃ³ xá»­

Ai Ä‘Ã³ Ä‘ang hÃºt thuá»‘c lÃ¡ á»Ÿ nÆ¡i cÃ³ biá»ƒn cáº¥m hÃºt thuá»‘c: trong thÆ° viá»‡n, cÃ¢y xÄƒng, ... vÃ  báº¡n muá»‘n yÃªu cáº§u anh ta Ä‘á»«ng hÃºt thuá»‘c ná»¯a. Báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ chá»n nhiá»u cÃ¡ch Ä‘á»ƒ giáº£i quyáº¿t, nhÆ°ng á»Ÿ báº¥t ká»³ trÆ°á»ng há»£p nÃ o, báº¡n Ä‘á»u muá»‘n ngÆ°á»i hÃºt pháº£i táº¯t thuá»‘c Ä‘i. Náº¿u báº¡n giáº­n dá»¯, báº¡n sáº½ khÃ´ng cÃ²n giá»¯ Ä‘Æ°á»£c phÃ©p lá»‹ch sá»±:

- Can't you read the sign, mister? No smoking allowed!
- It's against the law to smoke in elevators, mister!
(mister: quÃ­ Ã´ng)

Äiá»u báº¡n muá»‘n lÃ  Ã´ng ta Put out your cigarette! hoáº·c Quit smoking in here! , nhÆ°ng vá»›i hai cÃ¢u trÃªn, báº¡n Ä‘Ã£ lá»‹ch sá»± nÃ³i nÃªn Ä‘iá»u mÃ¬nh muá»‘n.

TÆ°Æ¡ng tá»± tháº¿, báº¡n hÃ£y thá»­ yÃªu cáº§u má»™t cÃ¡ch lá»‹ch sá»± hÆ¡n xem sao:

- Excuse me, but would you mind putting out your cigarette until
you're out of the elevator?
- I'm sorry, sir, but smoking in elevators isn't allowed.
- Please don't smoke in here, sir. It's against the law, and it's also
very annoying to nonsmokers.

LÆ°u Ã½ ráº±ng trong cÃ¡ch nÃ³i lá»‹ch sá»±, sir Ä‘Æ°á»£c dÃ¹ng nhiá»u hÆ¡n mister. Sir thá»ƒ hiá»‡n sá»± kÃ­nh trá»ng vÃ  trang trá»ng hÆ¡n mister.

TrÃªn Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  sÆ¡ lÆ°á»£c vá» lá»i yÃªu cáº§u trong tiáº¿ng Anh. DÃ¹ cho lÃ  trong tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng nÃ o Ä‘i ná»¯a, báº¡n nÃªn giá»¯ phÃ©p lá»‹ch sá»± Ä‘á»ƒ thay vÃ¬ Ä‘Æ°a ra nhá»¯ng cÃ¢u má»‡nh lá»‡nh khÃ´ khan, báº¡n nÃªn sá»­ dá»¥ng nhá»¯ng lá»i yÃªu cáº§u nháº¹ nhÃ ng, lá»‹ch sá»±. CÃ¡ch gá»i Ä‘iá»‡n Ä‘áº¿n má»™t cÃ´ng ty trong giao tiáº¿p tiáº¿ng Anh

Trang trÆ°á»›c
Trang sau Â 

Gá»i Ä‘iá»‡n Ä‘áº¿n má»™t cÃ´ng ty trong giao tiáº¿p tiáº¿ng Anh

Náº¿u má»™t ngÆ°á»i thÆ° kÃ½ hay má»™t ngÆ°á»i tiáº¿p tÃ¢n chÃ o báº¡n trÆ°á»›c, há» cÃ³ thá»ƒ Ä‘Ã²i há»i báº¡n trÃ¬nh bÃ y cÃ´ng viá»‡c vá»›i ngÆ°á»i mÃ  báº¡n muá»‘n nÃ³i chuyá»‡n â€” Ä‘áº·c biá»‡t náº¿u ngÆ°á»i Ä‘Ã³ náº±m trong ban giÃ¡m Ä‘á»‘c hay ráº¥t báº­n. Äá»«ng bá»±c mÃ¬nh vÃ¬ thá»§ tá»¥c nÃ y. CÃ´ng viá»‡c cá»§a má»™t ngÆ°á»i thÆ° kÃ½ lÃ  pháº£i tÆ°á»ng trÃ¬nh cho chá»§ cá»§a mÃ¬nh nhá»¯ng cÃº Ä‘iá»‡n gá»i vÃ  Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  thá»§ tá»¥c chuáº©n cho háº§u háº¿t cÃ¡c cÃ´ng ty Má»¹.

Má»™t cuá»™c Ä‘á»‘i thoáº¡i vá»›i má»™t thÆ° kÃ½ cÃ³ thá»ƒ diá»…n ra nhÆ° tháº¿ nÃ y:

ThÆ° kÃ½:  Good morning Jones Construction Company. May I help you?
Báº¡n:     Hello. This is Ali El-Hussein. May I speak with Mr. Jones, please?
ThÆ° kÃ½:  May I ask the nature of your business, please?
Báº¡n:     I'm with Duke Power, and I need to talk with Mr. Jones about his
building project on Woodlawn Road.
ThÆ° kÃ½:  Thank you. Just a moment.

NgÆ°á»i thÆ° kÃ½ há»i cÃ¢u: "May I ask the nature of your business, please?" Ä‘á»ƒ biáº¿t Ä‘Æ°á»£c Ä‘Ã³ cÃ³ pháº£i lÃ  cuá»™c gá»i liÃªn quan Ä‘áº¿n cÃ´ng viá»‡c hay khÃ´ng.

Báº¡n tháº¥y ráº±ng: ngÆ°á»i thÆ° kÃ½ biáº¿t Ä‘Æ°á»£c tÃªn ngÆ°á»i gá»i vÃ  lÃ½ do cuá»™c gá»i, vÃ¬ váº­y anh ta (hoáº·c cÃ´ ta) cÃ³ thá»ƒ quyáº¿t Ä‘á»‹nh cuá»™c gá»i cÃ³ quan trá»ng hay cÃ³ Ä‘Ã¡ng quáº¥y ráº§y Ã´ng chá»§ hay khÃ´ng. ThÃªm vÃ o Ä‘Ã³, thÃ´ng tin tÆ°á»ng trÃ¬nh nÃ y cÃ³ thá»ƒ Ä‘Æ°á»£c chuyá»ƒn Ä‘áº¿n Ã´ng Jones trÆ°á»›c â€” nhÆ° má»™t cÃ¡ch chuáº©n bá»‹ cho Ã´ng ta vá» cuá»™c gá»i:

"Mr. Jones, Mr. El-Hussein from Duke Power is calling about the Woodlawn Road project" - Ä‘Ã¢y chÃ­nh lÃ  lÃ½ do cuá»™c gá»i.

CÃ¡c bÃ i TÃ¬nh huá»‘ng tiáº¿ng Anh thÃ´ng dá»¥ng khÃ¡c:

  • Qui táº¯c chung khi gá»i Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i

Lá»i cáº£m Æ¡n trong tiáº¿ng Anh (Pháº§n 3)

Trang trÆ°á»›c
Trang sau Â 

Cáº£m Æ¡n vÃ¬ Ä‘Ã£ Ä‘Æ°á»£c táº±ng quÃ 

CÃ¡c cuá»™c há»™i thoáº¡i sau minh há»a cÃ¡ch nÃ³i lá»i cáº£m Æ¡n ai Ä‘Ã³ Ä‘Ã£ táº·ng quÃ  cho báº¡n.

1.
A:	Thank you very much for the beautiful book, Mr. Kincaid. It was
very nice of you to remember my birthday. (Formal)
B:	It was the least I could do. I hope you enjoy it.
2.
A:	The flowers are gorgeous! Thanks a lot, Bob!
B:	Don't mention it. Happy anniversary!
3.
A:	That was nice of you to bring us the coffee cake, Sarah. We'll
really enjoy it for breakfast in the morning!
B:	Oh, it was nothing! I hope you like it.
4.
A:	Wally, the bracelet is beautiful, but really, you shouldn't have!
B:	You're welcome. I think it looks beautiful on you.
5.
A:	Doris, these vegetables look fantastic! And you know what a salad
eater I am. Thanks a zillion!
B:	Any time! There are a lot more in my garden, so I'll bring you more later.
(
gorgeous: tuyá»‡t Ä‘áº¹p, rá»±c rá»¡
anniversary: ngÃ y (lá»…) ká»· niá»‡m
bracelet: vÃ²ng tay
zillion: ráº¥t nhiá»u
)

Trong Ä‘Ã³:

  • You shouldn't have lÃ  má»™t hÃ¬nh thá»©c giáº£n lÆ°á»£c thÃ¢n máº­t cá»§a "You shouldn't have done it (bought me this bracelet)".

  • a zillion lÃ  má»™t sá»‘ ráº¥t lá»›n (khÃ´ng cÃ³ thá»±c): nÃ³ cÃ³ nghÄ©a lÃ  ráº¥t nhiá»u.

ChÆ°Æ¡ng tá»›i mÃ¬nh sáº½ trÃ¬nh bÃ y cÃ¡ch nÃ³i lá»i cáº£m Æ¡n báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh Ä‘á»ƒ cáº£m Æ¡n ai Ä‘Ã³ Ä‘Ã£ giÃºp Ä‘á»¡ mÃ¬nh.

Lá»i má»i trong tiáº¿ng Anh: Do dá»±

Khi do dá»±, chÆ°a thá»ƒ tráº£ lá»i ngay

Khi nháº­n lá»i má»i cá»§a ai Ä‘Ã³, Ä‘Ã´i lÃºc báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ khÃ´ng muá»‘n tráº£ lá»i ngay lÃ  yes hay no. Do dá»± cÅ©ng cÃ³ nhiá»u cÃ¡ch, náº¿u báº¡n cáº§n thá»i gian Ä‘á»ƒ suy nghÄ© ká»¹ vá» lá»i má»i trÆ°á»›c khi quyáº¿t Ä‘á»‹nh.

Báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ sá»­ dá»¥ng cÃ¡c máº«u cÃ¢u sau khi thá»ƒ hiá»‡n thÃ¡i Ä‘á»™ do dá»± cá»§a mÃ¬nh trong tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng nÃ y:

- I'm not sure what my plans are at this moment. Could I let
you know on Friday?
- I may be busy that day. Do you mind if I tell you in a few days?
- Well, I'm not sure, but I may be busy.
- Well, I'm not sure, but I may be playing golf.
- My plans for that day are still up in the air. I'll let you know
by Tuesday, if that's okay with you.
- I appreciate the invitation, but I might have an appointment at
that time. Could I let you know later this week?
(appreciate: cáº£m kÃ­ch)
- Thanks a lot for the invitation, but I'll have to check my calendar.
Could I get back to you tonight?
(calendar: lá»‹ch cÃ´ng tÃ¡c, lá»‹ch lÃ m viá»‡c, ...)

Cáº¥u trÃºc to be still up in the air = not finalized yet hoáº·c not complete hoáº·c unsure cÃ³ nghÄ©a lÃ  chÆ°a cháº¯c cháº¯n.

- I am/was deeply sorry to hear about your father's death.

- I want to tell you how sorry I am that your grandmother is ill.

Lá»i cáº£nh bÃ¡o trong tiáº¿ng Anh

ÄÃ´i khi chÃºng ta á»Ÿ vÃ o trÆ°á»ng há»£p pháº£i bÃ¡o Ä‘á»™ng cho ai Ä‘Ã³ vá» má»™t chuyá»‡n nguy hiá»ƒm hoáº·c khÃ´ng may sáº¯p xáº£y ra. Láº½ Ä‘Æ°Æ¡ng nhiÃªn, cÃ¡ch bÃ¡o Ä‘á»™ng sáº½ tÃ¹y vÃ o má»©c Ä‘á»™ nguy hiá»ƒm, Ä‘e dá»a cá»§a tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng sáº¯p xáº£y Ä‘áº¿n.

TÃ¬nh huá»‘ng nguy hiá»ƒm

Trong tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng cá»±c ká»³ nguy hiá»ƒm nhÆ° khi má»™t chiáº¿c xe hÆ¡i Ä‘ang trá» tá»›i gáº§n má»™t ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡ch bá»™ hÃ nh khÃ´ng Ä‘á»ƒ Ã½, chÃºng ta sáº½ hÃ©t to:

- Hey! Look out!
- Watch out! There's a car coming!
- Get out of the way! Quick!

CÃ¹ng vá»›i nhá»¯ng thÃ¡n tá»« bÃ¡o Ä‘á»™ng lÃ  má»™t vÃ i Ä‘iá»‡u bá»™ nhÆ° váº«y tay, nháº£y, chá»‰ vÃ o chiáº¿c xe Ä‘ang trá» tá»›i (chÃºng ta khÃ´ng nghÄ© Ä‘áº¿n phÃ©p lá»‹ch sá»± vÃ o thá»i Ä‘iá»ƒm Ä‘Ã³), vÃ  tháº­m chÃ­ cÃ²n kÃ©o sá»‡t ngÆ°á»i Ä‘Ã³ ra khá»i nÆ¡i nguy hiá»ƒm.

Trong báº¥t ká»³ má»™t tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng Ä‘Ã¡ng sá»£ nÃ o, lá»i bÃ¡o Ä‘á»™ng thÃ´ng dá»¥ng nháº¥t thÆ°á»ng lÃ  cÃ¡c kháº©u lá»‡nh:

- Move!
- Look out!
- Be careful
- Get out of the way!
- Run!
- Duck! (CÃºi ngÆ°á»i xuá»‘ng)

ChÃºng ta khÃ´ng cáº§n phÃ­ thá»i gian cho nhá»¯ng cÃ¢u yÃªu cáº§u lá»‹ch sá»± Ä‘Ãºng phÃ©p táº¯c. Pháº£i la lá»›n bÃ¡o cho há» biáº¿t tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng nguy cáº¥p.

TÃ¬nh huá»‘ng khÃ´ng nguy hiá»ƒm

Náº¿u tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng khÃ´ng nguy hiá»ƒm Ä‘áº¿n tÃ­nh máº¡ng nhÆ° cÃ¡c vÃ­ dá»¥ trÆ°á»›c, khÃ´ng cáº§n pháº£i nÃ³i trá»±c tiáº¿p hoáº·c dÃ¹ng cÃ¡c cÃ¢u lá»‡nh khÃ´ khan. Giáº£ sá»­, má»™t anh báº¡n Ä‘Ã£ uá»‘ng say mÃ¨m pháº£i lÃ¡i xe vá» nhÃ . Báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ nÃ³i:

- Jerry, you'd better not drink any more. You have to drive home, remember?
hay
- Jerry, if I were you, I'd slow down on the beer drinking. You've got a
long drive home.

Sau Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t vÃ i cÃ¡ch cáº£nh cÃ¡o trong nhá»¯ng tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng Ã­t nguy hiá»ƒm hÆ¡n, tá»« lá»i cáº£nh cÃ¡o tháº³ng, trá»±c tiáº¿p Ä‘áº¿n nhá»¯ng lá»i khuyÃªn nháº¹ nhÃ ng hÆ¡n:

- You must stop smoking so much.
- You ought to eat less sugar and less red meat.
- You need to think twice about spending all that money on a stereo.
- You'd better not drive so fast.
- You should study harder or you might not pass.
- If I were you, I would not waste my time on that.
- If I were in your shoes, I would not waste my time on that.
- If I were in your situation, I would not waste my time on that.
- I think it would be a good idea if you exercised more.
- Don't you think you had better unplug the toaster before fixing it?
- Don't you think you ought to unplug the toaster before fixing it?
- Don't you think you should unplug the toaster before fixing it?
- Perhaps you should think about studying more and playing video games less.
- Maybe you ought to drive more carefully at night.

LÆ°u Ã½ sá»‘ Ä‘á»™ng tá»« khiáº¿m khuyáº¿t (must, ought to, should, had better) Ä‘Æ°á»£c sá»­ dá»¥ng Ä‘á»ƒ lÃ m dáº¥u cáº£nh cÃ¡o.

Hiá»ƒn nhiÃªn, ngÆ°á»i cÃ³ quyá»n cao hÆ¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ dÃ¹ng nhá»¯ng cÃ¢u cáº£nh cÃ¡o nghiÃªm kháº¯c hÆ¡n Ä‘á»‘i vá»›i nhá»¯ng ngÆ°á»i lÃ m viá»‡c dÆ°á»›i quyá»n. VÃ­ dá»¥, má»™t bÃ  giÃ¡m Ä‘á»‘c cÃ³ thá»ƒ nÃ³i vá»›i ngÆ°á»i bÃ¡n hÃ ng:

- Joe, your sales are slow this month. You need to get out there
and hustle more!
hustle (v): xoay xá»Ÿ

Má»™t Ã´ng phÃ³ chá»§ tá»‹ch nÃ³i vá»›i nhÃ¢n viÃªn dÆ°á»›i quyá»n:

Hay má»™t ngÆ°á»i máº¹ nÃ³i vá»›i cÃ´ con gÃ¡i:

ChÃº Ã½ trong vÃ­ dá»¥ hai vÃ  ba, kÃ¨m theo lá»i cáº£nh cÃ¡o ngÆ°á»i nÃ³i Ä‘Æ°a ra háº­u quáº£ sáº½ hoáº·c cÃ³ thá»ƒ xáº£y ra náº¿u khÃ´ng tuÃ¢n lá»i. Ã”ng phÃ³ chá»§ tá»‹ch cáº£nh cÃ¡o nhÃ¢n viÃªn vá» nguy cÆ¡ bá»‹ máº¥t chá»©c, vÃ  ngÆ°á»i máº¹ Ä‘áº» sáº½ "giam lá»ng" cÃ´ con gÃ¡i trong nhÃ  suá»‘t tuáº§n vÃ¬ khÃ´ng nghe lá»i. Äá»• lá»—i trong tiáº¿ng Anh

ChÆ°Æ¡ng trÆ°á»›c mÃ¬nh Ä‘Ã£ trÃ¬nh bÃ y cÃ¡ch than phiá»n báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh: than phiá»n trá»±c tiáº¿p hay nÃ³i bÃ³ng giÃ³. Äá»‰nh Ä‘iá»ƒm cá»§a than phiá»n lÃ  Ä‘á»• lá»—i. NgÆ°á»i ta Ä‘á»• háº¿t trÃ¡ch nhiá»‡m, lá»—i láº§m cho ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c. ChÆ°Æ¡ng nÃ y sáº½ trÃ¬nh bÃ y vá» Ä‘iá»u nÃ y.

Äá»• lá»—i báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh

CÃ¡ch thÃ´ng thÆ°á»ng Ä‘á»ƒ kÃªu ca lÃ  Ä‘á»• háº¿t lá»—i láº§m lÃªn má»™t ngÆ°á»i nÃ o khÃ¡c hoáº·c má»™t chuyá»‡n gÃ¬ Ä‘Ã³. ChÃºng ta thÆ°á»ng lÃ m Ä‘iá»u nÃ y báº±ng cÃ¡ch sá»­ dá»¥ng thá»ƒ bá»‹ Ä‘á»™ng (Passive Voice).

- This cake was cooked too long, I think. It tastes pretty dry.

Lá»i há»i thÄƒm trong tiáº¿ng Anh (Pháº§n 2)

Trang trÆ°á»›c
Trang sau Â 

Lá»i há»i thÄƒm trong tiáº¿ng Anh (Pháº§n 2)

PhÃ©p lá»‹ch sá»± khi há»i thÄƒm

Trong nhiá»u tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng, cÃ³ thá»ƒ xem lÃ  báº¥t lá»‹ch sá»± náº¿u báº¡n báº¯t Ä‘áº§u cÃ¢u há»i mÃ  khÃ´ng dÃ¹ng má»™t sá»‘ phÃ©p lá»‹ch sá»± tá»‘i thiá»ƒu. ChÃºng ta khÃ´ng chá»‰ há»i khÆ¡i khÆ¡i mÃ  Ä‘áº§u tiÃªn pháº£i máº¡n phÃ©p xin lá»—i ngÆ°á»i ta tráº£ lá»i cÃ¢u há»i cá»§a mÃ¬nh má»™t cÃ¡ch lá»‹ch sá»± theo nhá»¯ng cÃ¡ch sau:

- Excuse me. When...?
- Pardon me, ma'am, but where...?
- I hate to bother you, but what...?
- Sir, could you help me? How many...?
- Please. Mr............... Why...?

á» Ä‘Ã¢y, Pardon vÃ  Excuse cÃ³ nghÄ©a tÆ°Æ¡ng tá»± nhau. NgÆ°á»i Má»¹ thÆ°á»ng sá»­ dá»¥ng Excuse trong khi ngÆ°á»i Anh thÆ°á»ng sá»­ dá»¥ng Pardon. Cáº£ Pardon me vÃ  Excuse me Ä‘á»u cÃ³ nghÄ©a lÃ  Xin lá»—i Ä‘Ã£ lÃ m phiá»n.

Báº¡n cÅ©ng cÃ³ thá»ƒ báº¯t Ä‘áº§u cÃ¢u há»i báº±ng má»™t sá»‘ cá»¥m tá»« lá»‹ch sá»± nhÆ°: "Could you tell me..." "I was wondering..." hoáº·c "Do you know..." thÃ¬ trong pháº§n cÃ²n láº¡i cá»§a cÃ¢u báº¡n pháº£i Ä‘á»•i láº¡i vá»‹ trÃ­ thÃ´ng thÆ°á»ng cá»§a Ä‘á»™ng tá»« vÃ  chá»§ tá»«.

VÃ­ dá»¥:

- Excuse me, but would you mind telling me where the nearest bank is?
- Sir, I am/was wondering if you know/knew when the bank closes/closed.
- Ma'am, would you be so kind as to tell me how often the Dallas flight leaves?

VÃ­ dá»¥ thá»© ba (would you be so kind) nghe cÃ³ váº» quÃ¡ trá»‹nh trá»ng náº¿u khÃ´ng nÃ³i lÃ  quÃ¡ khÃ¡ch sÃ¡o. ÄÃ´i khi, nÃ³ cho tháº¥y ngÆ°á»i nÃ³i hÆ¡i phÃ´ trÆ°Æ¡ng. Vá»›i báº¡n bÃ¨ tá»‘t hÆ¡n Ä‘á»«ng nÃªn sá»­ dá»¥ng nhÆ°ng cÅ©ng nÃªn biáº¿t cÃ¢u nÃ y Ä‘á»ƒ nháº­n ra Ä‘Æ°á»£c khi nghe ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c nÃ³i.

Cuá»‘i cÃ¹ng khi nháº­n Ä‘Æ°á»£c thÃ´ng tin, báº¡n nÃªn lá»‹ch sá»± cÃ¡m Æ¡n ngÆ°á»i ta. VÃ  náº¿u cÃ³ pháº§n nÃ o mÃ  báº¡n khÃ´ng nghe Ä‘Æ°á»£c hay cho lÃ  mÃ¬nh nghe láº§m, Ä‘á»«ng ngáº§n ngáº¡i cá»© há»i láº¡i. Náº¿u biáº¿t báº¡n khÃ´ng pháº£i lÃ  ngÆ°á»i nÃ³i tiáº¿ng Anh nhÆ° lÃ  tiáº¿ng máº¹ Ä‘áº», thÆ°á»ng thÆ°á»ng há» sáº½ nÃ³i cháº­m hÆ¡n hoáº·c tráº£ lá»i cáº©n tháº­n vÃ  rÃµ rÃ ng hÆ¡n.

CÃ¡c bÃ i TÃ¬nh huá»‘ng tiáº¿ng Anh thÃ´ng dá»¥ng khÃ¡c:

  • Mong muá»‘n giá»¯ liÃªn láº¡c

  • Goodbye

  • TÃ¬nh huá»‘ng khÃ³ xá»­

  • Lá»i há»i thÄƒm

  • PhÃ©p lá»‹ch sá»± khi há»i thÄƒm

  • CÃ¡ch chá»‰ Ä‘Æ°á»ng

  • CÃ¡ch hÆ°á»›ng dáº«n

  • Lá»i cáº£m Æ¡n Ä‘Ã£ hÆ°á»›ng dáº«n

  • Cáº£m Æ¡n Ä‘Ã£ má»i

  • Cáº£m Æ¡n khi nháº­n quÃ 

  • Cáº£m Æ¡n vÃ¬ Ä‘Æ°á»£c giÃºp Ä‘á»¡

  • Cáº£m Æ¡n khi Ä‘Æ°á»£c khen ngá»£i

Trang trÆ°á»›c
PDF
Trang sau Â 
BÃ i viáº¿t liÃªn quan

ChÃº Ã½: Link ráº¥t nhiá»u bÃ i há»c khÃ¡c liÃªn quan á»Ÿ menu bÃªn trÃ¡i

CÃ¡c loáº¡t bÃ i khÃ¡c:

  • CÃ¡c thÃ¬ trong tiáº¿ng Anh (English Tenses)

  • Äá»™ng tá»« khuyáº¿t thiáº¿u (Modal Verb)

Tá»± giá»›i thiá»‡u báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh

Trang trÆ°á»›c
Trang sau Â 

A. Tá»± giá»›i thiá»‡u báº£n thÃ¢n báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh

Náº¿u báº¡n muá»‘n lÃ m quen hay muá»‘n báº¯t chuyá»‡n vá»›i má»™t ai Ä‘Ã³, báº¡n pháº£i lÃ m gÃ¬? CÅ©ng khÃ´ng khÃ³ láº¯m Ä‘Ã¢u, báº¡n chá»‰ cáº§n nhá»› cÃ¡c máº«u cÃ¢u giao tiáº¿p Ä‘á»ƒ tá»± giá»›i thiá»‡u báº£n thÃ¢n nhÆ° trong tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng dÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y:

Trong má»™t buá»•i tiá»‡c, báº¡n tiáº¿n Ä‘áº¿n lÃ m quen vá»›i má»™t cÃ´ gÃ¡i:
You:   Hi there. Are you enjoying the party?
Girl:  It's okay, I don't know many people here.
You:   Well, let me introduce myself, and you'll know one more person.

Girl:  Natasha Wolinski. I just moved in next door. Do you live in the building?
You:   No, but I have some good friends who do. I'll be glad to introduce
you to them tonight.
Girl:  Thanks. That would be nice.

DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t sá»‘ phÆ°Æ¡ng phÃ¡p Ä‘á»ƒ báº¯t Ä‘áº§u tá»± giá»›i thiá»‡u. Pháº£i nhá»› ráº±ng cÃ¡c qui táº¯c tÆ°Æ¡ng tá»± Ä‘Æ°á»£c Ã¡p dá»¥ng trong pháº§n giá»›i thiá»‡u thÃ´ng qua ngÆ°á»i thá»© ba, nhÆ° lÃ  cho thÃ´ng tin cáº§n thiáº¿t hoáº·c cÃ³ tÃ­nh cháº¥t cÃ¡ nhÃ¢n cÃ³ thá»ƒ Ä‘Æ°á»£c Ã¡p dá»¥ng á»Ÿ pháº§n nÃ y. Sau khi báº¡n Ä‘Ã£ tá»± giá»›i thiá»‡u vá» mÃ¬nh, hÃ£y cho ngÆ°á»i Ä‘á»‘i diá»‡n má»™t Ã­t thÃ´ng tin vá» báº¡n hay lÃ  há»i má»™t cÃ¢u há»i nÃ o Ä‘Ã³ vá» cÃ´ áº¥y hay anh áº¥y Ä‘á»ƒ cÃ³ cÆ¡ sá»Ÿ mÃ  báº¯t Ä‘áº§u cÃ¢u chuyá»‡n:

- May I introduce myself? I'm...(Trang trá»ng)

ThÆ°á»ng lÃ  báº¡n khÃ´ng nháº¥t thiáº¿t pháº£i há»i: "And who are you?" sau khi báº¡n Ä‘Ã£ tá»± giá»›i thiá»‡u bá»Ÿi vÃ¬ máº·c nhiÃªn ngÆ°á»i ta sáº½ pháº£i tá»± giá»›i thiá»‡u láº¡i nhÆ° sau:

(Ráº¥t vui khi biáº¿t báº¡n. TÃªn tÃ´i lÃ  ...)
- Hello. It's nice to meet you. I'm...
- Hi, I'm... Nice meeting you, too.
- Good to meet you. I'm...

ChÃ o táº¡m biá»‡t báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh (Pháº§n 2)

Mong muá»‘n tiáº¿p tá»¥c giá»¯ liÃªn láº¡c

TrÆ°á»›c lÃºc tá»« giÃ£, thá»‰nh thoáº£ng má»™t trong hai ngÆ°á»i sáº½ bÃ y tá» Ã½ muá»‘n giá»¯ liÃªn láº¡c vá»›i ngÆ°á»i kia. VÃ­ dá»¥, náº¿u Helen sáº¯p lÃªn Ä‘Æ°á»ng Ä‘áº¿n New York khoáº£ng hai thÃ¡ng, báº¡n cÃ¹ng phÃ²ng cá»§a chá»‹ áº¥y cÃ³ thá»ƒ nÃ³i nhÆ° tháº¿ nÃ y: 

- Don't forget to write!
Äá»«ng quÃªn viáº¿t thÆ° cho mÃ¬nh nhÃ©!
hoáº·c
- Let's call each other once a week!
ChÃºng mÃ¬nh hÃ£y gá»i Ä‘iá»‡n cho nhau má»™t láº§n má»—i tuáº§n nhÃ©!

Khi chÃ o táº¡m biá»‡t vá»›i nhá»¯ng ngÆ°á»i sá»‘ng trong cÃ¹ng thÃ nh phá»‘ hoáº·c gáº·p máº·t khÃ¡ thÆ°á»ng xuyÃªn, chá»‰ cáº§n nÃ³i 

- Let's keep in touch.
keep in touch: giá»¯ liÃªn láº¡c
hoáº·c
- Call me sometime.
Thi thoáº£ng gá»i cho mÃ¬nh.

CÃ¢u Call me sometime cÃ³ thá»ƒ khÃ´ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c lá»‹ch sá»± cho láº¯m vÃ  ngÆ°á»i Má»¹ thÆ°á»ng cÃ³ thÃ³i quen káº¿t thÃºc cuá»™c trÃ² chuyá»‡n má»™t cÃ¡ch vui váº», láº¡c quan. DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t sá»‘ cÃ¢u tiáº¿ng Anh thÃ´ng dá»¥ng cho tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng nÃ y:

- Let's get together soon.
- Let's get together again.
- Give me a call sometime!
- Give me a ring sometime!
- Keep in touch!
- Let's have lunch/dinner/coffee soon.
- I hope we meet again.
- Drop me a line.
- Stop by and see me sometime!

Trong Ä‘Ã³:

  • I hope we meet again Ä‘Æ°á»£c sá»­ dá»¥ng khi hai ngÆ°á»i gáº·p nhau láº§n Ä‘áº§u.

  • Drop me a line nghÄ©a lÃ  Write me a note or letter (viáº¿t thÆ° cho tÃ´i).

Sau cÃ¹ng, chÃºng ta sáº½ nÃ³i lá»i táº¡m biá»‡t thá»±c sá»±. Váº­y ngoÃ i Goodbye ra thÃ¬ chÃºng ta cÃ³ cÃ¡c cÃ¢u táº¡m biá»‡t nÃ o khÃ¡c hay vÃ  thÃ¢n máº­t hÆ¡n khÃ´ng. Má»i báº¡n tiáº¿p tá»¥c theo dÃµi chÆ°Æ¡ng tiáº¿p theo.

1.

B:	Oh, I'm sorry to hear that. We certainly will miss you. (Trang trá»ng)
2.

B:	Great! I'll know we'll have fun!
3.

B:	Good! The play starts at 8:00, so I'll pick you up at 7:30, Okay?
4.
A:	Sure! I've been wanting to go to a soccer game. Thanks for the invite!
B: 	You're welcome. I'm glad you can come.
5.

long time! Thanks for the invitation.

Lá»i há»i thÄƒm trong tiáº¿ng Anh (Pháº§n 1)

TÃ¬nh huá»‘ng

1. Giáº£ sá»­ báº¡n muá»‘n báº¯t xe buÃ½t tá»›i nhÃ  ngÆ°á»i báº¡n, vÃ  báº¡n khÃ´ng biáº¿t xe buÃ½t cÃ³ Ä‘i qua Ä‘áº¥y khÃ´ng. Báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ há»i ngÆ°á»i Ä‘á»©ng chá» á»Ÿ tráº¡m xe buÃ½t nhÆ° sau:

- What bus goes to this address?
Xe buÃ½t nÃ o Ä‘i qua Ä‘á»‹a chá»‰ nÃ y váº­y?
hoáº·c
- Do you know which bus I should take to get to this address?
Báº¡n cÃ³ biáº¿t chiáº¿c xe buÃ½t nÃ o tÃ´i nÃªn báº¯t Ä‘á»ƒ tá»›i Ä‘á»‹a chá»‰ nÃ y khÃ´ng?

2. Báº¡n Ä‘ang á»Ÿ siÃªu thá»‹ vÃ  muá»‘n mua nho khÃ´, nhÆ°ng báº¡n khÃ´ng biáº¿t chÃºng á»Ÿ Ä‘Ã¢u. Báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ há»i nhÃ¢n viÃªn siÃªu thá»‹ hay ngÆ°á»i nÃ o Ä‘Ã³:

- Where would I find the raisins?
hoáº·c
- What section are the raisins in?
(raisins: nho khÃ´)

Khi chÃºng ta cáº§n biáº¿t vá» má»™t chuyá»‡n nÃ o Ä‘Ã³, chÃºng ta thÆ°á»ng dÃ¹ng má»™t trong 6 tá»« Ä‘á»ƒ há»i nÃ y Ä‘á»ƒ báº¯t Ä‘áº§u cÃ¢u há»i:

- Who...?
Who is going to pick me up at airport tomorrow?
- What...?
What is the name of that new Italian restaurant?
- When...?
When does the next train to Washington leave?
- Where...?
Where is the best place to have my suit dry cleaned?
- Why...?
Why are the windows closed?
- How?
How do you want your steak cooked?
- How long...?
How long do you plan to travel in Europe?
- How many...?
How many employees work for Frank?
- How much...?
How much does a pint of milk cost?
- How far...?
How far is Los Angeles from San Francisco?
- How easy...?
How easy is it to find the subway station?
(suit: bá»™ com lÃª
steak: miáº¿ng cÃ¡ (miáº¿ng thá»‹t) Ä‘á»ƒ nÆ°á»›ng
pint = 0.57 lit (cá»§a Má»¹)
)

Khi báº¡n há»i, cÃ¡c cÃ¢u tráº£ lá»i nháº­n Ä‘Æ°á»£c pháº£i cá»¥ thá»ƒ, rÃµ rÃ ng. VÃ­ dá»¥, cÃ¡c cÃ¢u tráº£ lá»i cho cÃ¢u há»i Ä‘áº§u tiÃªn (Who? What? When? Where? Why? â€” trong vÃ­ dá»¥ Ä‘áº§u tiÃªn) cÃ³ thá»ƒ lÃ  nhá»¯ng cÃ¢u nÃ y: 

- John will.
- It's called the Italian Isles.

(conditioner: mÃ¡y Ä‘iá»u hÃ²a)

Há»i thÄƒm vÃ  lá»i Ä‘Ã¡p

ChÃºng ta cÅ©ng cÃ³ thá»ƒ há»i thÄƒm báº±ng cÃ¡ch báº¯t Ä‘áº§u cÃ¢u há»i vá»›i má»™t trá»£ Ä‘á»™ng tá»«, nhÆ°ng káº¿t quáº£ hÆ¡i khÃ¡c. Thay vÃ¬ pháº£i Ä‘Ã¡p láº¡i vá»›i má»™t thÃ´ng tin cá»¥ thá»ƒ, chÃºng ta thÆ°á»ng chá»‰ tráº£ lá»i yes hoáº·c no â€” nhÆ°ng sau Ä‘Ã³ chÃºng ta cÃ³ thá»ƒ giáº£i thÃ­ch thÃªm Ä‘á»ƒ cung cáº¥p thÃªm thÃ´ng tin cho ngÆ°á»i há»i.

VÃ­ dá»¥:

Q:	Do you sell women's clothes on this floor?
A:	Yes, just to your left.
Q:	Do you think it's going to snow tonight?
A:	No, it's not cold enough.
Q:	Do you have change for a dollar?
A:	No, but maybe Tom does.
Q:	Will he be in France long?
A:	No, only another week or so.
Q:	Will she come back soon?
A:	Yes, she'll be back May 20
Q:	Will they understand us when we speak?
A:	Yes, if we speak slowly.

Lá»i yÃªu cáº§u trong tiáº¿ng Anh

Trang trÆ°á»›c
Trang sau Â 

Lá»i yÃªu cáº§u trong tiáº¿ng Anh

Lá»i yÃªu cáº§u má»™t chuyá»‡n gÃ¬ Ä‘Ã³

YÃªu cáº§u má»™t chuyá»‡n gÃ¬ Ä‘Ã³ (xin, mÆ°á»£n, sá»­ dá»¥ng má»™t mÃ³n Ä‘á»“ cháº³ng háº¡n), báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ dÃ¹ng cÃ¡c hÃ¬nh thá»©c xin phÃ©p lá»‹ch sá»±. Háº§u háº¿t Ä‘á»u báº¯t Ä‘áº§u báº±ng trá»£ Ä‘á»™ng tá»«.

DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t vÃ i máº«u cÃ¢u thÃ´ng dá»¥ng:

- May I have an apple?
- May I have a Coke?
- May I have another helping of rice, please?
- Could I borrow ten dollars?
- Could I borrow your rake?
- Could I borrow that book, please?
- Can I use that umbrella?
- Can I use your hairdryer?
- Can I use the phone, if you don't mind?
- Would you mind if I had a sandwich?
- Would you mind if I borrowed your newspaper?
- Would you mind if I used your car this afternoon?

Lá»i yÃªu cáº§u xin giÃºp Ä‘á»¡

Äá»ƒ yÃªu cáº§u ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c lÃ m giÃ¹m má»™t chuyá»‡n gÃ¬, báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ sá»­ dá»¥ng cÃ¡c máº«u cÃ¢u sau:

- Could I trouble you to get me a cold drink?
- Could I trouble you to help me with this?
- Could I bother you to answer the phone?
- Will you answer the phone while I'm out, if you don't mind?
- Will you hand me that picture frame, please?
- Will you please clean your room before going outside?
- Would you mind not smoking at the table?
- Would you mind speaking more slowly, please?
- Would you mind retyping this letter before you leave?
- How about helping me with the dishes?
- How about picking up some soft drinks on your way home?
- What about turning your stereo down a little?

Trong Ä‘Ã³:

  • á» Ä‘Ã¢y, At the table = at the dinner table (trÃªn bÃ n Äƒn) hoáº·c while eating (trong khi Ä‘ang Äƒn).

  • Picking up = buying hoáº·c getting: mua

LÆ°u Ã½: Sau Would you mind vÃ  How/What about báº¡n cáº§n sá»­ dá»¥ng V-ing.

TrÃªn Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  cÃ¡c máº«u cÃ¢u khi báº¡n yÃªu cáº§u ai Ä‘Ã³ lÃ m chuyá»‡n gÃ¬ hay giÃºp Ä‘á»¡ báº¡n chuyá»‡n gÃ¬. Váº­y náº¿u nhÆ° báº¡n Ä‘Æ°á»£c yÃªu cáº§u, báº¡n Ä‘Ã¡p láº¡i lá»i yÃªu cáº§u Ä‘Ã³ nhÆ° tháº¿ nÃ o. Má»i báº¡n theo dÃµi chÆ°Æ¡ng tiáº¿p theo.

CÃ¡c bÃ i TÃ¬nh huá»‘ng tiáº¿ng Anh thÃ´ng dá»¥ng khÃ¡c:

  • CÃ¡ch chá»‰ Ä‘Æ°á»ng

  • CÃ¡ch hÆ°á»›ng dáº«n

Than phiá»n trong tiáº¿ng Anh

Than phiá»n trong tiáº¿ng Anh

Than phiá»n lÃ  cÃ¡ch biá»ƒu lá»™ sá»± Ä‘au Ä‘á»›n, báº¥t bÃ¬nh hoáº·c khÃ´ng báº±ng lÃ²ng. Má»—i ngÃ y chÃºng ta hay than van vá» thá»i tiáº¿t, vá» thá»©c Äƒn, giao thÃ´ng, cÃ´ng viá»‡c, cÃ¡c váº¥n Ä‘á» vá» tiá»n báº¡c, vÃ  nhá»¯ng váº¥n Ä‘á» khÃ¡c trong Ä‘á»i sá»‘ng.

Than phiá»n trá»±c tiáº¿p

Cháº¯c cháº¯n sáº½ ráº¥t báº¥t lá»‹ch sá»± náº¿u chÃºng ta ca cáº©m:

- This steak tastes like leather!
Miáº¿ng thá»‹t nÆ°á»›ng nÃ y sao dai nhÆ° da thuá»™c tháº¿!
steak (n): miáº¿ng thá»‹t (cÃ¡) nÆ°á»›ng
leather (n): da thuá»™c

vÃ¬ váº­y pháº£i nÃ³i táº¿ nhá»‹ vÃ  lá»‹ch sá»± hÆ¡n nhÆ° sau: 

- This steak seems to be overdone.
Miáº¿ng thá»‹t nÆ°á»›ng nÃ y dÆ°á»ng nhÆ° bá»‹ nÆ°á»›ng quÃ¡ lá»­a rá»“i.

PhÃ n nÃ n cÅ©ng cÃ³ nhiá»u cÃ¡ch, nhÆ°ng cÃ¡ch phá»• biáº¿n nháº¥t lÃ  nÃ³i tháº³ng sá»± tháº­t, sau Ä‘Ã³ má»›i há»i lÃ½ do hoáº·c yÃªu cáº§u lÃ m láº¡i (hay ngÆ°á»£c láº¡i).

- This report is incomplete. Finish it, please.

- Do you mind if I skip the meeting tonight? I'm very tired.

Skip cÃ³ thá»ƒ cÃ³ nghÄ©a lÃ  miss (nhá»¡, lá»¡) hoáº·c pass over (bá» qua) hoáº·c leave out (quÃªn).
á» vÃ­ dá»¥ trÃªn nÃ³ cÃ³ nghÄ©a lÃ  miss.

Than phiá»n giÃ¡n tiáº¿p

Äáº§u tiÃªn Bob than Ä‘au. Khi Alan há»i anh ta Ä‘Ã£ Ä‘i khÃ¡m bÃ¡c sÄ© chÆ°a, Bob than anh ta khÃ´ng cÃ³ thá»i gian. Lá»i cáº£m Æ¡n trong tiáº¿ng Anh (Pháº§n 4)

Trang trÆ°á»›c
Trang sau Â 

Lá»i cáº£m Æ¡n ai Ä‘Ã³ Ä‘Ã£ giÃºp Ä‘á»¡ mÃ¬nh

Khi Ä‘Æ°á»£c ai Ä‘Ã³ giÃºp Ä‘á»¡, vÃ¬ lá»‹ch sá»± báº¡n nÃªn nÃ³i lá»i cáº£m Æ¡n. CÃ¡c Ä‘oáº¡n há»™i thoáº¡i sau minh há»a cÃ¡ch nÃ³i lá»i cáº£m Æ¡n báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh cho tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng nÃ y.

1.
A:	Janice, you're a livesaver! I don't know what I would have
done if you hadn't helped me make the decorations for the party!
Thanks so much!
B:	Oh, it was nothing I'm glad I could help out.
(You are livesaver! Báº¡n Ä‘Ãºng lÃ  cá»©u tinh cá»§a mÃ¬nh.)
2.
A:	Thank for working with me on the computer, Bob. I'd been
struggling with it for over an hour before you came along.
B:	Don't worry about it. I enjoyed helping you.
(struggling: váº­t lá»™n)
3.
A:	Thanks for helping me with the dinner, Joe. I really appreciate it.
B:	It was the least I could do! Thanks for inviting me over.
(appreciate: cáº£m kÃ­ch)
4.
A: 	Thanks a million for lending me your car, Ted. That was a big help!
B:	I'm glad I could help. Let me know if you need to borrow it again.
(big help): sá»± giÃºp Ä‘á»¡ lá»›n lao
5.
A: 	You're so nice to help with the broken lamp, Don. I'm no good at
mechanical things.
B:	You're welcome. I'm glad I was able to fix it.
(lamp: Ä‘Ã¨n





mechanical: (thuá»™c) mÃ¡y mÃ³c)

ChÆ°Æ¡ng tá»›i mÃ¬nh sáº½ trÃ¬nh bÃ y cÃ¡ch nÃ³i lá»i cáº£m Æ¡n báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh Ä‘á»ƒ cáº£m Æ¡n ai Ä‘Ã³ Ä‘Ã£ khen ngá»£i mÃ¬nh.

CÃ¡c bÃ i TÃ¬nh huá»‘ng tiáº¿ng Anh thÃ´ng dá»¥ng khÃ¡c:

  • Mong muá»‘n giá»¯ liÃªn láº¡c

  • Goodbye

  • TÃ¬nh huá»‘ng khÃ³ xá»­

  • Lá»i há»i thÄƒm

  • PhÃ©p lá»‹ch sá»± khi há»i thÄƒm

  • CÃ¡ch chá»‰ Ä‘Æ°á»ng

  • CÃ¡ch hÆ°á»›ng dáº«n

  • Lá»i cáº£m Æ¡n Ä‘Ã£ hÆ°á»›ng dáº«n

  • Cáº£m Æ¡n Ä‘Ã£ má»i

  • Cáº£m Æ¡n khi nháº­n quÃ

  • Cáº£m Æ¡n khi Ä‘Æ°á»£c khen ngá»£i

Trang trÆ°á»›c

CÃ¡ch bÃ y tá» quan Ä‘iá»ƒm trong tiáº¿ng Anh

Trang trÆ°á»›c
Trang sau Â 

Báº¡n cÃ³ thÆ°á»ng á»Ÿ vÃ o tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c ai Ä‘Ã³ há»i Ã½ kiáº¿n:

- What do you think about...

NgÆ°á»i há»i muá»‘n Ä‘Æ°á»£c biáº¿t Ã½ kiáº¿n cá»§a báº¡n vá» má»™t váº¥n Ä‘á», vÃ  sau Ä‘Ã³ thÆ°á»ng Ä‘Æ°a Ä‘áº¿n má»™t cuá»™c tháº£o luáº­n (Ä‘á»“ng Ã½ hay khÃ´ng Ä‘á»“ng Ã½).

Biáº¿t cÃ¡ch phÃ¡t biá»ƒu Ã½ kiáº¿n, tÃ¡n thÃ nh hay khÃ´ng tÃ¡n thÃ nh chÃ­nh lÃ  kháº£ nÄƒng dá»¥ng tá»« vÃ  giao tiáº¿p xÃ£ há»™i, Ä‘Ã²i há»i báº¡n pháº£i biáº¿t má»™t sá»‘ thÃ nh ngá»¯ cá»‘ Ä‘á»‹nh vÃ  má»™t Ã­t khÃ©o lÃ©o.

ChÆ°Æ¡ng nÃ y chÃºng ta cÃ¹ng tÃ¬m hiá»ƒu cÃ¡ch bÃ y tá» Ã½ kiáº¿n, quan Ä‘iá»ƒm báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh.

CÃ¡ch bÃ y tá» quan Ä‘iá»ƒm trong tiáº¿ng Anh

DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t vÃ i cÃ¡ch tiÃªu biá»ƒu Ä‘á»ƒ báº¯t Ä‘áº§u cho ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c biáº¿t Ã½ kiáº¿n cá»§a báº¡n vá» má»™t Ä‘á» tÃ i. ÄÃ¢y chá»‰ lÃ  cÃ¡c máº«u cÃ¢u, vÃ  báº¡n cáº§n nÃªu Ã½ kiáº¿n, quan Ä‘iá»ƒm cá»§a mÃ¬nh sau má»—i máº«u nÃ y.

- The point I'm making is... (Trang trá»ng)
- In my opinion...
- It seems to me that...
- I believe that...
- I think that...
- I feel that...
- As I see it...
- If you ask me...
- Personally, I think....
- Frankly, I think...
opinion (n): quan Ä‘iá»ƒm, Ã½ kiáº¿n
Personally (n): vá»›i cÃ¡ nhÃ¢n tÃ´i, riÃªng tÃ´i
Frankly (n): tháº³ng tháº¯n, chÃ¢n thÃ nh

Táº¥t nhiÃªn, náº¿u báº¡n cháº¯c cháº¯n vá» Ã½ kiáº¿n, quan Ä‘iá»ƒm cá»§a mÃ¬nh, báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ thÃªm cÃ¡c tráº¡ng tá»« (strongly, really, firmly, wholeheartedly) Ä‘á»ƒ tÄƒng thÃªm "trá»ng lÆ°á»£ng" cho Ã½ kiáº¿n. Khi Ä‘Ã£ thÃªm tráº¡ng tá»«, báº¡n cáº§n nháº¥n giá»ng á»Ÿ tráº¡ng tá»« nÃ y.

VÃ­ dá»¥:

- I firmly believe inflation will get worse during the next ten months!
TÃ´i tin cháº¯c ráº±ng láº¡m phÃ¡t sáº½ trá»Ÿ nÃªn tá»“i tá»‡ trong 10 thÃ¡ng tá»›i!
inflation (n): láº¡m phÃ¡t

Thá»‰nh thoáº£ng náº¿u báº¡n khÃ´ng cháº¯c cháº¯n 100% vá» Ã½ kiáº¿n cá»§a mÃ¬nh, báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ Ä‘iá»u chá»‰nh lá»i má»Ÿ Ä‘áº§u báº±ng cÃ¡ch thÃªm vÃ o má»™t sá»‘ tá»« nÃ o Ä‘Ã³. VÃ­ dá»¥:

- Well. I'm not quite sure, but I believe...
- I still have some doubts, but my feeling is that...
- Although I'm not 100 percent sure, I still think that...
- Well, I don't know, but I'm beginning to think that...
doubt (n): khÃ´ng cháº¯c, sá»± há»“ nghi, nghi ngá»

Nhá»¯ng cÃ¢u nÃ y cho ngÆ°á»i nghe biáº¿t chÃºng ta cÃ³ Ã½ kiáº¿n riÃªng cá»§a mÃ¬nh, máº·c dÃ¹ nÃ³ khÃ´ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c máº¡nh vÃ  váº«n cÃ²n nhiá»u hoÃ i nghi nhÆ°ng Ä‘Ã³ váº«n lÃ  má»™t Ã½ kiáº¿n.

TrÃªn Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  cÃ¡c máº«u cÃ¢u chá»‰ cho báº¡n cÃ¡ch bÃ y tá» quan Ä‘iá»ƒm, Ã½ kiáº¿n cÃ¡ nhÃ¢n báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh. Váº­y lÃ m tháº¿ nÃ o Ä‘á»ƒ há»i Ã½ kiáº¿n, quan Ä‘iá»ƒm cá»§a ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c. Má»i báº¡n tiáº¿p tá»¥c theo dÃµi chÆ°Æ¡ng tiáº¿p theo.

Lá»i khen trong tiáº¿ng Anh: Lá»i khen sá»± khÃ©o lÃ©o hay tÃ i nÄƒng

Lá»i khen trong tiáº¿ng Anh: Lá»i khen sá»± khÃ©o lÃ©o hay tÃ i nÄƒng

ChÆ°Æ¡ng trÆ°á»›c, chÃºng ta Ä‘Ã£ khen ngá»£i váº» Ä‘áº¹p vá» Ä‘Ã´i máº¯t, kiá»ƒu tÃ³c, vá» vÃ³c dÃ¡ng báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh. Trong pháº§n nÃ y, mÃ¬nh trÃ¬nh bÃ y cÃ¡ch Ä‘á»ƒ khen ngá»£i sá»± khÃ©o lÃ©o hay tÃ i nÄƒng cá»§a ai Ä‘Ã³.

Khen ngá»£i sá»± khÃ©o lÃ©o, tÃ i nÄƒng

DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t sá»‘ lá»i khen tiÃªu biá»ƒu vÃ  cÃ¡ch Ä‘Ã¡p láº¡i:

Pat:    I didn't know you could play the guitar so well, Nak. Your song
was lovely!
Nak:    Thanks, Pat. I'm glad you enjoyed it.
Yumi:   Joe, your backhand is getting stronger every time we play!
Joe:    Do you really think so? I've been practicing every day, and I'm
pleased you can see an improvement.
Maxine: Bud, your photographs are unbelievable! I really wish you'd give
me some advice to help my pictures come out better.
(Khen ai Ä‘Ã³ trÆ°á»›c rá»“i sau Ä‘Ã³ yÃªu cáº§u sá»± giÃºp Ä‘á»¡)
Bud:    Thank you, Maxine. I'm not sure how much help I can be, but I'd be
glad to give you a few tips.
backhand (n): cÃº ve bÃ³ng báº±ng tay trÃ¡i, cÃº Ä‘Ã¡nh bÃ³ng báº±ng tay trÃ¡i
improvement (n): sá»± tiáº¿n bá»™, sá»± cáº£i thiá»‡n
photographs (n): bá»©c áº£nh
unbelievable (adj): khÃ´ng thá»ƒ tin Ä‘Æ°á»£c (vá»›i vÃ­ dá»¥ trÃªn: tuyá»‡t Ä‘áº¹p)
tips (n): lá»i khuyÃªn, máº¹o, chá»‰ dáº«n

Báº¡n cÅ©ng cáº§n phÃ¢n biá»‡t sá»± khÃ¡c biá»‡t giá»¯a khen vÃ  ná»‹nh. Lá»i khen tháº­t lÃ²ng khÃ´ng há» mang báº¥t cá»© má»™t Ä‘á»™ng cÆ¡ nÃ o (khÃ´ng nháº±m báº¥t ká»³ lÃ½ do hay má»¥c Ä‘Ã­ch gÃ¬). NhÆ°ng lá»i phá»‰nh ná»‹nh thÆ°á»ng lÃ  lá»i khen khÃ´ng tháº­t, vÃ¬ má»™t má»¥c Ä‘Ã­ch Ä‘áº·c biá»‡t nÃ o Ä‘Ã³.

TÃ¬nh huá»‘ng: Giáº£ thiáº¿t ráº±ng John muá»‘n anh báº¡n cÃ¹ng phÃ²ng, Jack giÃºp anh áº¥y lÃ m bÃ i táº­p Anh vÄƒn. Biáº¿t Jack Ä‘ang báº­n, John bÃ¨n tÃ¬m cÃ¡ch ná»‹nh vÃ i cÃ¢u Ä‘á»ƒ thuyáº¿t phá»¥c Jack lÃ m dÃ¹m. HÃ£y xem máº«u Ä‘á»‘i thoáº¡i sau, cÃ³ Ä‘Ãºng lÃ  John Ä‘ang "tÃ¡n" Jack lÃªn táº­n mÃ¢y xanh khÃ´ng â€” rÃµ rÃ ng anh ta Ä‘ang chá»§ tÃ¢m ná»‹nh Jack cÃ³ má»¥c Ä‘Ã­ch:

John:  You know, Jack, your English is much better than most Americans'.
Jack:  Thanks, John, but really mine's not so good. I make a lot of
mistakes â€” like most people.
John:  But you really understand the rules of grammar better than most
people. And you're so patient with people â€” like with my Spanish friends.
When they're visiting and they ask you a question you take the time to
answer and explain it. Not many Americans do that. Well,
I was... uh... wondering Jack, could you take a look at my composition
and let me know if I've made any big mistakes? I'd really appreciate it.
Jack:  Well, er... I don't know, John. I really think you ought to do
your own work.
John:  I've done the work! It's just that you're a lot better at spotting
grammar mistakes than I am, and I'd really appreciate your helping me out.
Jack:  Well, okay. I guess I could point out a few of your big mistakes,
but I want you to try to correct them yourself, Okay?
John:  Sure! And thanks a lot, Jack.
rules of grammar: qui táº¯c ngá»¯ phÃ¡p
mistake (n): lá»—i
composition (n): bÃ i luáº­n
appreciate (v): cáº£m kÃ­ch
spot (v): Ä‘á»‹nh vá»‹, phÃ¡t hiá»‡n

KhÃ´ng khÃ³ Ä‘á»ƒ dá»‹ch Ä‘oáº¡n há»™i thoáº¡i trÃªn pháº£i khÃ´ng. Báº¡n cÃ³ nháº­n tháº¥y ráº±ng John Ä‘ang khen hay lÃ  Ä‘ang ná»‹nh Jack Ä‘á»ƒ nhá» anh áº¥y lÃ m giÃºp bÃ i táº­p cho mÃ¬nh. CÃ³ láº½ Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t vÃ­ dá»¥ thÃº vá»‹ vá»›i cÃ¡c báº¡n.

Qui táº¯c chung khi gá»i Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i trong tiáº¿ng Anh

Trang trÆ°á»›c
Trang sau Â 

Qui táº¯c sá»­ dá»¥ng Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i trong giao tiáº¿p

DÃ¹ng Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i lÃ  má»™t pháº§n thiáº¿t yáº¿u cá»§a cuá»™c sá»‘ng hÃ ng ngÃ y chÃºng ta. ChÃºng ta dÃ¹ng Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i Ä‘á»ƒ gá»i ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c Ä‘á»ƒ biáº¿t xem há» sá»‘ng ra sao, Ä‘á»ƒ há»i thÄƒm tin tá»©c, Ä‘á»ƒ phÃ n nÃ n, Ä‘á»ƒ xin lá»—i, Ä‘á»ƒ chuyá»ƒn nhá»¯ng thÃ´ng bÃ¡o, Ä‘á»ƒ há»i vÃ  cho hÆ°á»›ng dáº«n vÃ  vÃ¬ nhiá»u lÃ½ do khÃ¡c ná»¯a.

Vá»›i nhiá»u ngÆ°á»i, khi sá»­ dá»¥ng tiáº¿ng Anh lÃ  ngÃ´n ngá»¯ thá»© hai, cÃ³ thá»ƒ há» cáº£m tháº¥y khÃ´ng tá»± tin hoáº·c lÃ  sá»£ pháº£i sá»­ dá»¥ng tiáº¿ng Anh trong khi giao tiáº¿p qua Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i.

Äá»«ng lo láº¯ng! Nghi thá»©c Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i (tá»©c cÃ¡c quy luáº­t xÃ£ há»™i Ä‘á»ƒ gá»i hay nháº­n nhá»¯ng cÃº gá»i Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i) dÃ­nh lÃ­u Ä‘áº¿n Ã½ thá»©c vÃ  sá»± lá»‹ch sá»± chung. Báº¡n chá»‰ cáº§n theo cÃ¡c qui táº¯c Ä‘Æ¡n giáº£n trong loáº¡t bÃ i nÃ y thÃ¬ viá»‡c sá»­ dá»¥ng Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i trong giao tiáº¿p sáº½ trá»Ÿ nÃªn dá»… dÃ ng hÆ¡n.

TrÆ°á»›c háº¿t, báº¡n cáº§n ghi nhá»› má»™t sá»‘ Ä‘iá»u sau:

  • Ä‚n nÃ³i lá»‹ch sá»± vÃ  rÃµ rÃ ng. Bá»Ÿi vÃ¬ báº¡n (hoáº·c há») khÃ´ng nhÃ¬n tháº¥y Ä‘iá»‡u bá»™, cá»­ chá»‰, nÃ©t máº·t cá»§a nhau.

  • Láº¯ng nghe cáº©n tháº­n Ä‘iá»u ngÆ°á»i ta nÃ³i hay há»i báº¡n.

Khi gá»i Ä‘iá»‡n:

  • Náº¿u báº¡n lÃ  ngÆ°á»i gá»i: cáº§n lá»‹ch sá»± Ä‘Æ°a ra má»™t lá»i chÃ o, giá»›i thiá»‡u tÃªn mÃ¬nh vÃ  trÃ¬nh bÃ y cÃ´ng viá»‡c hay lÃ½ do báº¡n gá»i Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i.

  • Náº¿u báº¡n muá»‘n nÃ³i chuyá»‡n riÃªng vá»›i ai, hÃ£y há»i ngÆ°á»i Ä‘Ã³ báº±ng tÃªn ngÆ°á»i báº¡n muá»‘n nÃ³i chuyá»‡n

  • Náº¿u báº¡n Ä‘ang gá»i má»™t ngÆ°á»i báº¡n á»Ÿ nhÃ , báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ nÃ³i: 

    - "Hello. This is Michael Deering. Could I speak to Tom, please?"
Xin chÃ o. TÃ´i lÃ  Michael Deering. Cho tÃ´i nÃ³i chuyá»‡n vá»›i Tom?

    Tuy nhiÃªn, náº¿u báº¡n Ä‘ang gá»i má»™t ngÆ°á»i nÃ³i Ä‘Ã³ á»Ÿ má»™t cÃ´ng ty, báº¡n cáº§n pháº£i há»i Ä‘áº¿n phÃ²ng lÃ m viá»‡c cá»§a ngÆ°á»i Ä‘Ã³ trÆ°á»›c, sau Ä‘Ã³ khi báº¡n Ä‘Ã£ Ä‘Æ°á»£c ná»‘i dÃ¢y vá»›i ngÆ°á»i trong phÃ²ng Ä‘Ã³ thÃ¬ báº¡n má»›i há»i tÃªn ngÆ°á»i cáº§n gá»i.

Khi tráº£ lá»i:

  • Háº§u háº¿t cÃ¡c cÃ´ng ty thÆ°Æ¡ng máº¡i Ä‘á»u tráº£ lá»i báº±ng tÃªn cÃ´ng ty vÃ  "May I help you?".

  • CÃ¡c cÃ¡ nhÃ¢n á»Ÿ nhÃ  thÆ°á»ng tráº£ lá»i báº±ng cÃ¢u chÃ o Ä‘Æ¡n giáº£n Hello hay Ä‘Ã´i lÃºc lÃ  tÃªn chá»— á»Ÿ cá»§a mÃ¬nh, vÃ­ dá»¥: "John residence".

  • ÄÃ´i khi, ngÆ°á»i á»Ÿ cÃ´ng sá»Ÿ hay á»Ÿ nhÃ  cÃ³ thá»ƒ tráº£ lá»i báº±ng tÃªn cá»§a há», vÃ­ dá»¥: "David Bailey speaking" hoáº·c "Pat McCall here".

- Can I speak to Jerry, please?
HÃ¬nh thá»©c trang trá»ng, thÆ°á»ng dÃ¹ng vá»›i ngá»¯ cáº£nh cÃ´ng sá»Ÿ

Hai cÃ¢u cuá»‘i thá»ƒ hiá»‡n sá»± thÃ¢n máº­t, khi ngÆ°á»i gá»i vÃ  ngÆ°á»i tráº£ lá»i Ä‘á»u biáº¿t rÃµ nhau:

Sá»­ dá»¥ng may lá»‹ch sá»± hÆ¡n lÃ  dÃ¹ng could hay can.

CÃ¡ch Ä‘Ã¡p láº¡i lá»i khen trong tiáº¿ng Anh

Trang trÆ°á»›c
Trang sau Â 

Nhá»¯ng lá»i khen táº·ng lÃ  biá»ƒu hiá»‡n cá»§a lÃ²ng ngÆ°á»¡ng má»™, tÃ´n kÃ­nh hoáº·c tÃ¡n dÆ°Æ¡ng. Má»i ngÆ°á»i ai cÅ©ng thÃ­ch Ä‘Æ°á»£c khen; vÃ¬ lá»i khen sáº½ lÃ m ta cáº£m tháº¥y tá»± hÃ o. Khen vÃ  Ä‘Ã¡p láº¡i lá»i khen lÃ  má»™t pháº§n thiáº¿t yáº¿u trong Ä‘á»i sá»‘ng hÃ ng ngÃ y cá»§a chÃºng ta.

CÃ¡ch Ä‘Ã¡p láº¡i lá»i khen báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh

CÃ¡ch Ä‘Ã¡p láº¡i lá»i khen báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh cÅ©ng khÃ´ng pháº£i lÃ  khÃ³ khÄƒn láº¯m. DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t vÃ i cÃ¡ch Ä‘á»ƒ báº¯t Ä‘áº§u Ä‘Ã¡p láº¡i khi Ä‘Æ°á»£c khen. Nhá»¯ng cÃ¡ch nÃ y sáº½ thay Ä‘á»•i tÃ¹y theo tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng vÃ  lá»i khen Ä‘áº·c trÆ°ng. 

- You're too kind. (Trang trá»ng) (Lá»i khen: The dinner was delicious)
- Thank you for saying so. (Lá»i khen: You did a fine job on the report)
- I appreciate the compliment. (Lá»i khen: That's a beautiful belt!)
- Thank you. I'm glad you like it. (Lá»i khen: Your hair looks nice)
- Thank you. I'm glad you enjoyed it. (Lá»i khen: The cake was wonderful)
- Thank you. I'm glad you think so. (Lá»i khen: Your car drives great!)
- Thanks. I like your _________, too. (nháº¯c láº¡i lá»i khen)
kind (adj): tá»­ táº¿
belt (n): dÃ¢y tháº¯t lÆ°ng, xÄƒng tia
appreciate (v): cáº£m kÃ­ch
compliment (n): lá»i khen
glad (adj): vui lÃ²ng, sung sÆ°á»›ng, ...

Thá»‰nh thoáº£ng táº¥t cáº£ chÃºng ta Ä‘á»u bá»‹ lÃºng tÃºng vÃ¬ Ä‘Æ°á»£c khen mÃ  láº¡i pháº£i cá»‘ tá» váº» vui lÃ²ng Ä‘á»ƒ lÃ m ngÆ°á»i khen ta vui lÃ¢y. Náº¿u báº¡n khÃ´ng Ä‘á»“ng Ã½ vá»›i lá»i khen táº·ng, cá»© pháº£n Ä‘á»‘i khÃ´ng sao cáº£, nhÆ°ng pháº£i lá»‹ch sá»± vÃ  má»m má»ng.

Lá»i khen trong tiáº¿ng Anh: Lá»i khen vá» Ä‘á»“ váº­t

Qua cÃ¡c chÆ°Æ¡ng trÆ°á»›c, chÃºng ta Ä‘Ã£ biáº¿t cÃ¡ch khen diá»‡n máº¡o, tÃ i nÄƒng, sá»± khÃ©o lÃ©o vÃ  káº¿t quáº£ cÃ´ng viá»‡c báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh. Trong chÆ°Æ¡ng nÃ y, mÃ¬nh trÃ¬nh bÃ y cÃ¡ch Ä‘á»ƒ khen ngá»£i ai Ä‘Ã³ cÃ³ Ä‘á»“ gÃ¬ má»›i, Ä‘áº¹p, ...

Khen ngá»£i vá» Ä‘á»“ váº­t

Khen ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c vá» mÃ³n Ä‘á»“ cá»§a há» nhÆ°: má»™t mÃ³n ná»¯ trang, má»™t chiáº¿c xe hÆ¡i, má»™t cÃ¡i Ã¡o, má»™t tÃ¡c pháº©m nghá»‡ thuáº­t ... cÅ©ng tá»‘t nhÆ°ng pháº£i cáº©n tháº­n Ä‘á»«ng quÃ¡ lá»‘. VÃ­ dá»¥, náº¿u nÃ³i "That's a beautiful watch, Greg" thÃ¬ khÃ´ng sao, nhÆ°ng náº¿u há»i thÃªm "How much did you pay for it?" thÃ¬ khÃ´ng hay chÃºt nÃ o. Báº¡n pháº£i háº¿t sá»©c cáº©n tháº­n trÃ¡nh nhá»¯ng cÃ¢u há»i quÃ¡ riÃªng tÆ° vÃ  trá»±c tiáº¿p, Ä‘áº·c biá»‡t lÃ  nhá»¯ng cÃ¢u há»i cÃ³ liÃªn quan Ä‘áº¿n tiá»n báº¡c, tuá»•i tÃ¡c hoáº·c giá»›i tÃ­nh.

Äá»«ng khen quÃ¡ Ä‘Ã  vÃ  Ä‘á»«ng há»i nhá»¯ng cÃ¢u há»i cÃ¡ nhÃ¢n mÃ  há» khÃ´ng muá»‘n tráº£ lá»i vÃ¬ cÃ³ thá»ƒ lÃ m cáº£ hai pháº£i ngÆ°á»£ng.

DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t sá»‘ vÃ­ dá»¥ vá» cÃ¡c lá»i khen táº·ng vá» váº­t dá»¥ng vÃ  cÃ¡ch tráº£ lá»i:

what it is but they make you look older.
Bob:    Thanks. I take that as a compliment, I guess. I think they help
my new image as a banker, don't you.

Lá»i xin lá»—i trong tiáº¿ng Anh

Trong cuá»™c sá»‘ng, nhiá»u lÃºc chÃºng ta cáº§n nÃ³i lá»i xin lá»—i. CÃ¡ch Ä‘Æ¡n giáº£n nháº¥t Ä‘á»ƒ xin lá»—i lÃ  nÃ³i I'm sorry! nhÆ°ng chÆ°a Ä‘á»§. VÃ­ dá»¥: báº¡n vÃ o lá»›p muá»™n, báº¡n cáº§n xin lá»—i ngay: I'm sorry I'm late rá»“i sau Ä‘Ã³ má»›i xin phÃ©p vÃ o lá»›p. Äá»ƒ trÃ¡nh máº¥t thá»i gian cá»§a cáº£ lá»›p, báº¡n khÃ´ng nÃªn trÃ¬nh nÃ y lÃ½ do ngay mÃ  sau buá»•i há»c báº¡n nÃªn gáº·p riÃªng giÃ¡o viÃªn vÃ  Ä‘Æ°a ra lÃ½ do, cháº³ng háº¡n: .

- Professor Johnson, I'm sorry I was late for class this morning.
I'm afraid I overslept and missed the bus.
GiÃ¡o sÆ° Johnson, em xin lá»—i vÃ¬ Ä‘Ã£ tá»›i trá»… sÃ¡ng nay. Em e ráº±ng em Ä‘Ã£ ngá»§
quÃªn vÃ  lá»¡ chuyáº¿n xe buÃ½t.

Khi nÃ³i lÃ½ do vá»›i ngÆ°á»i mÃ  ta pháº£i xin lá»—i, chÃºng ta pháº£i thÃ nh tháº­t nháº­n trÃ¡ch nhiá»‡m vá» phÃ­a mÃ¬nh.

Láº½ Ä‘Æ°Æ¡ng nhiÃªn lÃ  cÅ©ng cÃ³ lÃºc chÃºng ta xin lá»—i giÃ¹m cho ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c. VÃ­ dá»¥, má»™t Ã´ng bá»‘ trong siÃªu thá»‹ nÃ³i vá»›i cÃ´ thu ngÃ¢n:

TÃ´i xin lá»—i vÃ¬ Ä‘á»©a con trai cá»§a tÃ´i Ä‘Ã£ bÃ³c thanh káº¹o Ä‘Ã³. TÃ´i xin vui lÃ²ng tráº£
tiá»n cho thanh káº¹o.

Sau lá»i xin lá»—i, Ä‘Ã´i lÃºc (nhÆ°ng khÃ´ng pháº£i luÃ´n luÃ´n) lÃ  lá»i há»©a sáº½ thay Ä‘á»•i, sá»­a chá»¯a khÃ´ng tÃ¡i pháº¡m ná»¯a. VÃ­ dá»¥ sau khi há»c sinh nÃ³i rÃµ lÃ½ do Ä‘áº¿n lá»›p trá»…, anh ta cÃ³ thá»ƒ nÃ³i thÃªm:

ChÃ o táº¡m biá»‡t báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh (Pháº§n 3)

Goodbye

Hai pháº§n trÆ°á»›c mÃ¬nh Ä‘Ã£ cÃ¹ng tÃ¬m hiá»ƒu: CÃ¢u nÃ³i trÆ°á»›c khi chÃ o táº¡m biá»‡t vÃ  cÃ¡ch nÃ³i Ä‘á»ƒ mong muá»‘n Ä‘Æ°á»£c tiáº¿p tá»¥c giá»¯ liÃªn láº¡c. Sau cÃ¹ng, chÃºng ta sáº½ nÃ³i lá»i táº¡m biá»‡t.

Tá»« Goodbye khÃ´ng pháº£i lÃ  tá»« duy nháº¥t Ä‘Æ°á»£c dÃ¹ng; tháº­t sá»± thÃ¬ Goodbye thá»‰nh thoáº£ng khiáº¿n chÃºng ta cÃ³ cáº£m giÃ¡c "vÄ©nh biá»‡t", nÃªn cÃ³ má»™t sá»‘ tá»« vÃ  cá»¥m tá»« thÆ°á»ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c thay tháº¿ cho tá»« nÃ y. ÄÃ¢y lÃ  má»™t sá»‘ cÃ¢u táº¡m biá»‡t khÃ¡c. 

- Farewell! (Táº¡m biá»‡t!)
- Take care. (Báº£o trá»ng.)
- Have a good day.
- Have a nice day.
- Have a nice week.
- So long! (= Goodbye)
- Take it easy.
- Later (ThÃ¢n máº­t)
- See you around. (ThÃ¢n máº­t)
- See you later. (ThÃ¢n máº­t)

Trong Ä‘Ã³:

  • Farewell Ã­t khi Ä‘Æ°á»£c dÃ¹ng, nhÆ°ng thá»‰nh thoáº£ng váº«n Ä‘Æ°á»£c dÃ¹ng bá»Ÿi ngÆ°á»i thÃ­ch phÃ³ng Ä‘áº¡i tÃ­nh nghiÃªm trá»ng cá»§a viá»‡c chia tay vÃ  cá»‘ gáº¯ng pha trÃ².

  • See you around vÃ  See you later khÃ´ng nÃªn dÃ¹ng Ä‘á»ƒ nÃ³i vá»›i ngÆ°á»i mÃ  báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ sáº½ khÃ´ng gáº·p ná»¯a.

Äáº¿n Ä‘Ã¢y, báº¡n Ä‘Ã£ biáº¿t cÃ¡ch Ä‘á»ƒ chÃ o táº¡m biá»‡t báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh. Tuy nhiÃªn, Ä‘Ã´i khi báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ gáº·p má»™t tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng khÃ³ xá»­, cháº³ng háº¡n nhÆ°: báº¡n muá»‘n táº¡m biá»‡t vÃ  Ä‘i vá» nhÆ°ng ngÆ°á»i Ä‘á»‘i diá»‡n cá»© nÃ³i thao thao báº¥t tuyá»‡t, thÃ¬ báº¡n sáº½ lÃ m nhÆ° tháº¿ nÃ o. Má»i báº¡n theo dÃµi chÆ°Æ¡ng tiáº¿p theo.

CÃ¡c bÃ i TÃ¬nh huá»‘ng tiáº¿ng Anh thÃ´ng dá»¥ng khÃ¡c:

  • VÃ  cÃ²n ráº¥t nhiá»u loáº¡t bÃ i há»c khÃ¡c....

Tá»« chá»‘i lá»i má»i trong tiáº¿ng Anh

Trang trÆ°á»›c
Trang sau Â 

Tá»« chá»‘i lá»i má»i trong tiáº¿ng Anh

CÃ¡ch tá»« chá»‘i lá»i má»i báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh

Äá»ƒ tá»« chá»‘i lá»i má»i cá»§a má»™t ai Ä‘Ã³ báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh, thÃ¬ tÃ¹y theo ngá»¯ cáº£nh trang trá»ng hay thÃ¢n máº­t thÃ¬ báº¡n nÃªn sá»­ dá»¥ng cÃ¡c máº«u cÃ¢u tÆ°Æ¡ng á»©ng.

DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  nhá»¯ng máº«u cÃ¢u báº¡n nÃªn nÃ³i khi tá»« chá»‘i lá»i má»i báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh.

- Thank you, but I'm afraid I have other plans for that night. (Trang trá»ng)
(LÃ½ do: cÃ³ káº¿ hoáº¡ch khÃ¡c cho tá»‘i Ä‘Ã³ rá»“i)
- Thank you, but I'm afraid I have an appointment that day. (Trang trá»ng)
(LÃ½ do: cÃ³ cuá»™c háº¹n khÃ¡c rá»“i)
- I'm sorry. I can't go to the movie with you, I... (Ä‘Æ°a ra lÃ½ do)
- I'm sorry. I can't join you in New York that weekend, I... (Ä‘Æ°a ra lÃ½ do)
- I wish I could, but I'm busy. Maybe another time, though.
- I hate to turn you down, but I must... (Ä‘Æ°a ra lÃ½ do)
- I would love to any other time, but I've already made plans.
- I would like to any other time, but I've already made plans.
- Thanks for asking, but... (Ä‘Æ°a ra lÃ½ do)
- I appreciate the invitation, but I'm afraid I can't.
- I'm afraid I can't, but thanks anyway.
- I'm tied up that day. What about the 14th?
- I'm tied up that night. What about a rain check
(tied up: báº­n
rain check: dá»‹p khÃ¡c)

  • turn (someone hoáº·c something) down = refuse: tá»« chá»‘i. ChÃºng ta turn down (tá»« chá»‘i) ngÆ°á»i, lá»i má»i, lá»i yÃªu cáº§u, ...

CÃ¡ch Ä‘Ã¡p láº¡i lá»i yÃªu cáº§u báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh

Trang sau Â 

CÃ¡ch Ä‘Ã¡p láº¡i lá»i yÃªu cáº§u báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh

ChÃºng ta cÃ³ thá»ƒ tráº£ lá»i yes hay no cho lá»i yÃªu cáº§u. NhÆ°ng thÆ°á»ng khÃ´ng chá»‰ tráº£ lá»i Ä‘Æ¡n giáº£n no rá»“i ngÆ°ng á»Ÿ Ä‘Ã³ mÃ  pháº£i xin lá»—i vÃ  giáº£i thÃ­ch lÃ½ do táº¡i sao tá»« chá»‘i.

Tráº£ lá»i Ä‘á»“ng Ã½

Khi Ä‘á»“ng Ã½, ngoÃ i cÃ¢u tráº£ lá»i yes, tÃ¹y theo ngá»¯ cáº£nh lÃ  trang trá»ng hay thÃ¢n máº­t, báº¡n cÅ©ng cÃ³ khÃ¡ nhiá»u máº«u cÃ¢u Ä‘á»ƒ diá»…n táº£ ráº±ng báº¡n Ä‘á»“ng Ã½ lá»i yÃªu cáº§u Ä‘Ã³:

- Yes, I'm more than willing to contribute to the Cancer Society (Trang trá»ng)
- Certainly, I'd love to help with the dance decorations.
- Certainly, I'd like to help with the dance decorations.
- Of course, it's no problem to change your appointment to Friday.
- No, it wouldn't be any trouble to get you more tea.
- Not at all. (Tráº£ lá»i cho lá»i yÃªu cáº§u dáº¡ng "Would you mind...?")
- I don't mind one bit watering your plants while you're away.
- Sure, I'll be glad to help you fix dinner.

- No sweat. I don't mind lending you my skis. (Ráº¥t thÃ¢n máº­t)

Trong Ä‘Ã³:

  • one bit cÃ³ nghÄ©a lÃ  even a little hoáº·c at all (chÃºt nÃ o cáº£), vÃ  Ä‘Æ°á»£c dÃ¹ng vá»›i thá»ƒ phá»§ Ä‘á»‹nh: It didn't hurt one bit.

Tráº£ lá»i khÃ´ng Ä‘á»“ng Ã½

Khi khÃ´ng Ä‘á»“ng Ã½ lá»i yÃªu cáº§u cá»§a ai Ä‘Ã³, báº¡n cáº§n tá»« chá»‘i vÃ  nÃªn nÃ³i ra lÃ½ do táº¡i sao. Äá»«ng tá»« chá»‘i má»™t cÃ¡ch cá»¥t lá»§n vÃ¬ nhÆ° váº­y lÃ  khÃ¡ máº¥t lá»‹ch sá»±.

- I wish I could let you borrow $20.00, but...

CÃ¡ch chá»‰ Ä‘Æ°á»ng báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh

TrÆ°á»›c háº¿t, chÃºng ta cÃ¹ng Ã´n láº¡i cÃ¡ch há»i Ä‘Æ°á»ng báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh.

CÃ¡ch há»i Ä‘Æ°á»ng báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh

Báº¡n Ä‘Ã£ biáº¿t cÃ¡ch há»i thÄƒm Ä‘Æ°á»ng vÃ  xin chá»‰ dáº«n trong chÆ°Æ¡ng trÆ°á»›c vÃ¬ nÃ³ cÅ©ng báº¯t Ä‘áº§u tÆ°Æ¡ng tá»± nhÆ° khi báº¡n há»i thÄƒm vá» má»™t chuyá»‡n gÃ¬ Ä‘Ã³. VÃ­ dá»¥:

- Excuse me. How do I get to the library from here?
- Pardon me, but could you tell me how to load this camera?
- Uh, sir, would you mind telling me where the nearest bank is located
and how to get there?

NhÆ°ng pháº£i tráº£ lá»i nhÆ° tháº¿ nÃ o náº¿u cÃ³ ai Ä‘Ã³ Ä‘áº¿n vÃ  há»i báº¡n?

CÃ¡ch chá»‰ Ä‘Æ°á»ng báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh

CÃ³ nhiá»u cÃ¡ch nÃ³i Ä‘áº·c biá»‡t mÃ  báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ sá»­ dá»¥ng Ä‘á»ƒ chá»‰ Ä‘Æ°á»ng. Äáº§u tiÃªn, báº¡n thÆ°á»ng dÃ¹ng nhá»¯ng cÃ¢u ra lá»‡nh Ä‘Æ¡n giáº£n nhÆ°:

- Walk two blocks west.
- Turn right.
- Drive south for three miles, then follow the signs to Lake Wylie.
- Stop at the third house.
- Look for a store that sells groceries.

Hoáº·c Ä‘Ã´i lÃºc chÃºng ta thÃªm tá»« you vÃ o: "You walk two blocks, and then you turn right."

CÃ³ nhiá»u tá»« vÃ  thÃ nh ngá»¯ Ä‘áº·c trÆ°ng dÃ¹ng Ä‘á»ƒ chá»‰ nÆ¡i chá»‘n hoáº·c vá»‹ trÃ­ Ä‘Æ°á»£c sáº¯p xáº¿p theo chá»©c nÄƒng cá»§a chÃºng trong cÃ¢u. DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t vÃ i Ä‘á»™ng tá»« thÆ°á»ng dÃ¹ng khi chá»‰ Ä‘Æ°á»ng.

go          turn          take (a left)    head for
walk        get on/off    look             stop
drive       continue      stop             keep + V-ing

VÃ  dÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t sá»‘ giá»›i tá»« hay cá»¥m giá»›i tá»« Ä‘Æ°á»£c sá»­ dá»¥ng Ä‘á»ƒ miÃªu táº£ vá»‹ trÃ­:

near: gáº§n
on the opposite side of: Ä‘á»‘i diá»‡n
between: giá»¯a
around the corner from

on your left/right: bÃªn tay trÃ¡i/pháº£i
in front of: Ä‘áº±ng trÆ°á»›c, á»Ÿ trÆ°á»›c
on the corner (of): gÃ³c (cá»§a)
behind: Ä‘áº±ng sau
on (tÃªn Ä‘Æ°á»ng): trÃªn (Ä‘Æ°á»ng)
across from: dá»c tá»«
adjacent to: ráº¥t gáº§n, sÃ¡t bÃªn
to the left/right: tá»›i bÃªn trÃ¡i/pháº£i

Khi vá»«a chá»‰ Ä‘Æ°á»ng vá»«a hÆ°á»›ng dáº«n, chÃºng ta thÆ°á»ng theo má»™t trÃ¬nh tá»± thá»i gian. Äá»ƒ lÃ m Ä‘iá»u nÃ y báº¡n nÃªn dÃ¹ng má»™t vÃ i tá»« ná»‘i nhÆ° lÃ :

first (second, third, ...): Ä‘áº§u tiÃªn

now

DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t sá»‘ danh tá»« chá»‰ vá»‹ trÃ­ khÃ¡c:

intersection: ngÃ£ tÆ° Ä‘Æ°á»ng, Ä‘iá»ƒm giao nhau
("at the intersection of ... and ...": )
crosswalk: Ä‘Æ°á»ng dÃ nh qua ngÆ°á»i Ä‘i bá»™
traffic light/signal: tÃ­n hiá»‡u/Ä‘Ã¨n giao thÃ´ng

("Walk 3 blocks" hoáº·c "It's 3 blocks from....")
parallel: Ä‘Æ°á»ng song song
(streets run like parallel: cÃ¡c con Ä‘Æ°á»ng cháº¡y gáº§n song song)

(streets run like...)
dead end: ngÃµ cá»¥t; cÃ³ thá»ƒ gá»i "no outlet"
uptown/downtown (thÆ°á»ng khÃ´ng cÃ³ sá»± khÃ¡c biá»‡t giá»¯a hai tá»« nÃ y ngoáº¡i trá»« á»Ÿ
má»™t sá»‘ Ã­t thÃ nh phá»‘ nhÆ° New York vÃ¬ cÃ³ nhá»¯ng khu Ä‘áº·c biá»‡t nhÆ° Uptown, Downtown, Midtown)
north/south/east/west: báº¯c/nam/Ä‘Ã´ng/tÃ¢y

CÃ³ thá»ƒ báº¡n phÃ¢n vÃ¢n khÃ´ng rÃµ Ä‘iá»ƒm khÃ¡c nhau giá»¯a block (lÃ´ Ä‘áº¥t) vÃ  building (tÃ²a nhÃ ). á» nÆ°á»›c ngoÃ i, thÃ nh phá»‘ Ä‘Æ°á»£c qui hoáº¡ch thÃ nh cÃ¡c lÃ´ Ä‘áº¥t khÃ¡ rÃµ rÃ ng, vÃ  trong má»—i lÃ´ Ä‘áº¥t thÃ¬ cÃ³ ráº¥t nhiá»u tÃ²a nhÃ .

Cuá»‘i cÃ¹ng khi Ä‘Ã£ chá»‰ Ä‘Æ°á»ng xong, báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ nÃ³i nhÆ° sau Ä‘á»ƒ káº¿t thÃºc:

- You can't miss it!
- You'll run right into it.
- You'll drive or walk right up to it.
- You'll see it immediately.
- It's right there.

BÃ¢y giá» báº¡n Ä‘Ã£ tá»± tin Ä‘á»ƒ chá»‰ Ä‘Æ°á»ng cho ai Ä‘Ã³ chÆ°a. DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t cuá»™c há»™i thoáº¡i máº«u minh há»a cÃ¡ch há»i Ä‘Æ°á»ng vÃ  chá»‰ Ä‘Æ°á»ng báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh.

Stranger:  Excuse me. Could you give me some directions?
You:  What are you looking for?
Stranger:  A drugstore, and I don't have a car.
You:  Well, there's one about five blocks away on Elliott Street.
Stranger:  How do I get there?
You:  Walk straight ahead until you come to the second traffic light.
Then turn right.
Stranger:  Do you know the name of the street?
You:  I can't remember, but it's the second right. Turn right and the
drugstore will be on your left about two blocks down. It's next to a bank.
I don't think you'll have any trouble spotting it.
Stranger:  Thanks a lot. I appreciate it.
(drugstore: hiá»‡u thuá»‘c (Má»¹)
spot: xÃ¡c Ä‘á»‹nh vá»‹ trÃ­
)

CÃ¡ch hÆ°á»›ng dáº«n báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh

Viá»‡c hÆ°á»›ng dáº«n cÅ©ng cÃ³ má»™t sá»‘ hÃ¬nh thá»©c tÆ°Æ¡ng tá»± nhÆ° chá»‰ Ä‘Æ°á»ng (dÃ¹ng cÃ¢u má»‡nh lá»‡nh Ä‘Æ¡n giáº£n). DÄ© nhiÃªn lÃ  cÃ³ sá»­ dá»¥ng nhá»¯ng tráº¡ng tá»« chá»‰ thá»i gian. HÆ°á»›ng dáº«n nghÄ©a lÃ  chá»‰ cho ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c biáº¿t cÃ¡c thao tÃ¡c cáº§n lÃ m. VÃ­ dá»¥ náº¿u John Ä‘ang chá»‰ cho má»™t ngÆ°á»i báº¡n báº­t mÃ¡y stereo, anh ta cÃ³ thá»ƒ nÃ³i nhÆ° váº§y:

First, plug in the stereo. Then press the "power" button and hold it down
firmly until a green light appears. Next, select the equipment you want to
play: the radio, the tape player, the record player, or the television.
Turn the switch to the proper one. If you want to play a record, put it on
the turntable and press "start". If you want to play a cassette, insert the
cassette face-up, close the door, and press "start". If you want to play the
radio or TV, select the proper channel. After that, adjust the volume and
enjoy the entertainment.
(
plug in: cáº¯m phÃ­ch Ä‘iá»‡n
press: nháº¥n
button: nÃºt
green: mÃ n hÃ¬nh
equipment: phÆ°Æ¡ng tiá»‡n
turntable (danh tá»«): máº·t quay hÃ¬nh trÃ²n, pháº³ng trÃªn Ä‘Ã³ Ä‘áº·t Ä‘Ä©a hÃ¡t Ä‘á»ƒ quay
channel: kÃªnh
)

LÆ°u Ã½ cÃ¡c liÃªn tá»« chá»‰ tráº­t tá»± thá»i gian dÃ¹ng trong lÃºc hÆ°á»›ng dáº«n nhÆ°: first, then, next, after that. CÃ¡c tá»« nÃ y sáº½ lÃ m cho viá»‡c chá»‰ dáº«n máº¡ch láº¡c vÃ  rÃµ rÃ ng hÆ¡n.

Chá» Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i trong giao tiáº¿p tiáº¿ng Anh

Trang trÆ°á»›c
Trang sau Â 

Chá» Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i trong giao tiáº¿p tiáº¿ng Anh

Náº¿u ngÆ°á»i báº¡n Ä‘ang há»i tá»›i chÆ°a nÃ³i chuyá»‡n Ä‘Æ°á»£c ngay, ngÆ°á»i báº¡n Ä‘ang nÃ³i chuyá»‡n vá»›i cÃ³ thá»ƒ yÃªu cáº§u báº¡n chá» má»™t chÃºt. ÄÃ¢y lÃ  má»™t vÃ i cÃ¢u phá»• thÃ´ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c dÃ¹ng:

- Would you mind holding a minute while I try to find her? (Trang trá»ng)
- Could you hold, please?
- Please hold a moment.
- One       |
- Just a    | moment, please.
- Wait a    |
TÃ¬nh huá»‘ng thÃ¢n máº­t:
- Hang on. I'll get him. (ThÃ¢n máº­t)
- Just a sec. (ThÃ¢n máº­t)

sec lÃ  má»™t hÃ¬nh thá»©c giáº£n lÆ°á»£c cá»§a second, thÆ°á»ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c dÃ¹ng trong cÃ¡c cuá»™c Ä‘Ã m thoáº¡i thÃ¢n máº­t.

Äiá»u gÃ¬ xáº£y ra náº¿u ngÆ°á»i báº¡n Ä‘ang gá»i khÃ´ng á»Ÿ Ä‘Ã³ hay cÅ©ng Ä‘ang báº­n nghe Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i? NgÆ°á»i tráº£ lá»i Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i sáº½ chuyá»ƒn thÃ´ng tin nÃ y vÃ  sau Ä‘Ã³ thÆ°á»ng há»i báº¡n cÃ³ muá»‘n nháº¯n láº¡i gÃ¬ cho ngÆ°á»i Ä‘Ã³ hay khÃ´ng, báº¡n cÃ³ muá»‘n ngÆ°á»i Ä‘Ã³ gá»i láº¡i cho báº¡n khÃ´ng hay báº¡n cÃ³ muá»‘n sau Ä‘Ã³ gá»i láº¡i khÃ´ng. DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t vÃ i cÃ¡ch mÃ  ngÆ°á»i ta cÃ³ thá»ƒ diá»…n Ä‘áº¡t thÃ´ng tin nÃ y.

- I'm sorry, but Mr. Jones is not here right now. May I take a
message or would you like to call back later?
- Ms. Lee is tied up now. Would you like to leave a message?
- Ms. Lee is busy now. Would you like to call back later?
- Ms. Lee is occupied now. Would you like to have her return your call?
- I'm afraid Dr. King can't come to the phone at this time.
- I'm afraid Dr. King can't speak to you at this time.
- I'm afraid Dr. King can't take the call at this time.
- Could you call back in a few minutes?
- Could you call back in a little while?
- Could you call back later?
- I'm sorry, but Margarita is not in at the moment. Would you like to
leave a message or call back later?

Tied up lÃ  má»™t thÃ nh ngá»¯ Ä‘á»ƒ biá»ƒu lá»™ cho busy hay occupied (báº­n)

CÃ¡c bÃ i TÃ¬nh huá»‘ng tiáº¿ng Anh thÃ´ng dá»¥ng khÃ¡c:

  • Qui táº¯c chung khi gá»i Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i

Lá»i xin lá»—i báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh

Trang trÆ°á»›c
Trang sau Â 

Lá»i xin lá»—i báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh

CÃ¡c máº«u cÃ¢u xin lá»—i thÃ´ng dá»¥ng

DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  cÃ¡c máº«u cÃ¢u thÃ´ng dá»¥ng báº¡n nÃªn sá»­ dá»¥ng khi cáº§n xin lá»—i ai Ä‘Ã³ báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh. CÃ¡c tá»« hay cáº¥u trÃºc thÆ°á»ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c sá»­ dá»¥ng lÃ  pháº§n Ä‘Æ°á»£c in Ä‘áº­m:

- I beg your pardon, sir. (I didn't realize you were speaking to me) (Trang trá»ng)
- Pardon me, please, for stepping on your foot. (Trang trá»ng)
- I hope you'll forgive my absence yesterday. I was ill. (Trang trá»ng)
(pardon (n): sá»± tha thá»©
(v): tha thá»© )
- Excuse me for being late. I forgot about the time.
- I appologize for knocking over your cup. I didn't see it.
- I'm very sorry ...
- I'm really sorry that I woke you.
- I'm awfully sorry ...
- Sorry about the steak. I'll be glad to prepare you another one.
- Sorry about that. (ThÃ¢n máº­t)

Máº«u cÃ¢u diá»…n Ä‘áº¡t sá»± tha thá»©

Khi Ä‘Æ°á»£c ai Ä‘Ã³ xin lá»—i, báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ sá»­ dá»¥ng cÃ¡c máº«u cÃ¢u sau Ä‘á»ƒ diá»…n Ä‘áº¡t ráº±ng báº¡n tha lá»—i cho ngÆ°á»i Ä‘Ã³.

- That's quite all right. (Trang trá»ng)
- Think nothing of it.
- It's all right.
- Don't worry about it.
- No harm done.
- That's okay.
- Forget it. (ThÃ¢n máº­t)
- No problem. (ThÃ¢n máº­t)
- No big thing. (ThÃ¢n máº­t)
- No sweat. (Ráº¥t thÃ¢n máº­t)

Trong Ä‘Ã³, no big thing cÃ³ nghÄ©a lÃ  Ä‘iá»u Ä‘Ã³ khÃ´ng quan trá»ng láº¯m, vÃ  báº¡n Ä‘á»«ng lo láº¯ng vá» Ä‘iá»u Ä‘Ã³.

CÃ¡ch thá»ƒ hiá»‡n sá»± khÃ´ng Ä‘á»“ng Ã½, tÃ¡n thÃ nh trong tiáº¿ng Anh

KhÃ´ng tÃ¡n thÃ nh Ã½ kiáº¿n cá»§a ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c hÆ¡i khÃ³ khÄƒn hÆ¡n vÃ¬ cÃ³ vÃ i yáº¿u tá»‘ cáº§n pháº£i xem xÃ©t láº¡i trÆ°á»›c khi quyáº¿t Ä‘á»‹nh khÃ´ng Ä‘á»“ng Ã½. Äáº§u tiÃªn vÃ  cÃ³ láº½ quan trá»ng nháº¥t chÃ­nh lÃ  má»‘i quan há»‡ giá»¯a ta vÃ  ngÆ°á»i kia.

Náº¿u lÃ  ngÆ°á»i thÃ¢n, báº¡n bÃ¨

Náº¿u má»—i quan há»‡ giá»¯a hai ngÆ°á»i lÃ  quen thÃ¢n, cÃ³ thá»ƒ phá»§ quyáº¿t Ã½ kiáº¿n cá»§a há» máº¡nh dáº¡n vÃ  tháº³ng tháº¯n hÆ¡n.

DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t sá»‘ vÃ­ dá»¥:

- You've got to be kidding!
- You've got to be joking!
- Are you joking?
- Are you kidding me?
- Are you crazy?
- Don't make me laugh!
- That's absurd!
- That's ridiculous!
- You can't really be serious!
- You can't really believe that!
- You can't really think that!
- Oh, come off it. (Ráº¥t thÃ¢n máº­t)
- Oh, get out of here! (Ráº¥t thÃ¢n máº­t)

joke (v): nÃ³i Ä‘Ã¹a
absurd (adj): buá»“n cÆ°á»i

Xin hÃ£y nhá»› ráº±ng nhá»¯ng cÃ¢u nÃ y lÃ  nhá»¯ng cÃ¢u pháº£n Ä‘á»‘i ráº¥t tháº³ng tháº¯n vÃ  khÃ¡ thÃ¢n máº­t. ChÃºng ta chá»‰ sá»­ dá»¥ng vá»›i báº¡n bÃ¨ trong tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng thÃ¢n máº­t. Náº¿u dÃ¹ng trong lÃºc tháº£o luáº­n vá»›i ngÆ°á»i khÃ´ng quen hay trong cÃ¡c bá»‘i cáº£nh trang trá»ng sáº½ khÃ´ng phÃ¹ há»£p vÃ  tháº­m chÃ­ bá»‹ coi lÃ  thÃ´ lá»—.

Trong trÆ°á»ng há»£p khÃ¡c: kinh doanh, khÃ´ng quen thÃ¢n, ...

Vá»›i trÆ°á»ng há»£p nÃ y, báº¡n cáº§n thá»±c sá»± khÃ©o lÃ©o, sá»­ dá»¥ng ngÃ´n ngá»¯ sao cho thÃ­ch há»£p vá»›i hoÃ n cáº£nh. ChÃºng ta lÃ m giáº£m bá»›t má»©c Ä‘á»™ khÃ´ng tÃ¡n thÃ nh Ä‘á»ƒ khÃ´ng thÃ´ lá»— vÃ  xÃºc pháº¡m Ä‘áº¿n ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c.

DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  cÃ¡c cÃ¡ch thá»ƒ hiá»‡n sá»± khÃ´ng Ä‘á»“ng Ã½, sá»± khÃ´ng tÃ¡n thÃ nh má»™t cÃ¡ch lá»‹ch sá»±. 1. HoÃ n toÃ n khÃ´ng Ä‘á»“ng Ã½ (quyáº¿t liá»‡t)

2. HoÃ n toÃ n khÃ´ng Ä‘á»“ng Ã½ (má»©c Ä‘á»™ nháº¹ hÆ¡n)

3. KhÃ´ng Ä‘á»“ng Ã½ má»™t pháº§n

- You could be right, but don't you think that...?

- I have to disagree with you, but I believe...

Trong báº£y vÃ­ dá»¥ sau cÃ¹ng, lÆ°u Ã½ chÃºng ta thá»«a nháº­n Ã½ kiáº¿n cá»§a ngÆ°á»i kia (cÃ³ thá»ƒ cÅ©ng Ä‘á»“ng Ã½ má»™t pháº§n), nhÆ°ng káº¿ Ä‘Ã³ chÃºng ta pháº£n bÃ¡c má»™t cÃ¡ch nhÃ£ nháº·n vÃ  Ä‘Æ°a ra chá»§ Ã½ cá»§a mÃ¬nh.

A. ÄÃ¡p láº¡i lá»i giá»›i thiá»‡u trong giao tiáº¿p tiáº¿ng Anh

ChÆ°Æ¡ng trÆ°á»›c mÃ¬nh Ä‘Ã£ trÃ¬nh bÃ y cÃ¡c cÃ¢u thÃ´ng dá»¥ng vÃ  cÃ¡c cÃ¡ch thá»©c Ä‘á»ƒ giá»›i thiá»‡u thÃ´ng qua ngÆ°á»i thá»© ba trong giao tiáº¿p tiáº¿ng Anh. Váº­y lÃ m tháº¿ nÃ o Ä‘á»ƒ Ä‘Ã¡p láº¡i lá»i giá»›i thiá»‡u?

VÃ¬ tháº¿ sau khi C Ä‘Ã£ giá»›i thiá»‡u A vÃ  B, báº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ Ä‘Ã¡p láº¡i nhÆ° sau (tá»« trá»‹nh trá»ng Ä‘áº¿n thÃ¢n máº­t):

1.

B:  It's a pleasure to meet you. (Trang trá»ng)
2.
A:  Hello, B. I'm pleased to meet you.
B:  Yes, it's nice to meet you, too.
3.
A:  Hello. Good to meet you.
B:  Nice meeting you, too.
4.
A:  Hi, B. Nice to meet you.
B:  Same here. (ThÃ¢n máº­t)

How do you do? khÃ´ng pháº£i lÃ  má»™t cÃ¢u há»i thá»±c sá»± nÃªn khÃ´ng cáº§n pháº£i cÃ³ cÃ¢u tráº£ lá»i (nÃ³ khÃ´ng giá»‘ng nhÆ° How are you doing?): cÃ¢u nÃ y thÆ°á»ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c dÃ¹ng nháº¥t trong nhá»¯ng lá»i giá»›i thiá»‡u trá»‹nh trá»ng.

CÃ¡ch lÃ m ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c Ä‘á»“ng Ã½ vá»›i mÃ¬nh trong tiáº¿ng Anh

Nhiá»u lÃºc báº¡n muá»‘n ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c Ä‘á»“ng Ã½ vá»›i mÃ¬nh, tháº¿ lÃ  báº¡n bÃ¨n váº­n dá»¥ng ngÃ´n ngá»¯ (hay kháº£ nÄƒng "Äƒn nÃ³i") Ä‘á»ƒ cá»‘ lÃ´i kÃ©o ngÆ°á»i Ä‘Ã³ vá» cÃ¹ng phe. CÃ¡ch khÃ¡ phá»• biáº¿n lÃ  nÃªu lÃªn Ã½ kiáº¿n rá»“i sau Ä‘Ã³ thÃ²ng vÃ o má»™t cÃ¢u há»i Ä‘uÃ´i:

- It's hot in here, isn't it?
- That was a fantastic burger, wasn't it?
- San Francisco is certainly a beautiful city, isn't it?
- That surely wasn't a very interesting movie, was it?

Pháº§n cÃ¢u há»i Ä‘uÃ´i thÆ°á»ng xuá»‘ng giá»ng khi ngÆ°á»i nÃ³i háº§u nhÆ° cháº¯c cháº¯n ráº±ng ngÆ°á»i nghe sáº½ Ä‘á»“ng Ã½ hoáº·c hy vá»ng ngÆ°á»i nghe sáº½ Ä‘á»“ng Ã½.

Nhá»¯ng cÃ¡ch khÃ¡c ná»¯a lÃ m ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c pháº£i Ä‘á»“ng Ã½ vá»›i mÃ¬nh lÃ  Ä‘áº·t cÃ¢u há»i theo kiá»ƒu "má»›m" cho ngÆ°á»i tráº£ lá»i biáº¿t nhá»¯ng gÃ¬ mÃ  ta muá»‘n Ä‘Æ°á»£c nghe. 

- Don't you think it's hot in here?
- Don't you agree that was a fantastic burger?
- Isn't San Francisco a beautiful city?
- Wasn't that a boring movie?

Trong hai vÃ­ dá»¥ Ä‘áº§u tiÃªn, ngÆ°á»i nÃ³i Ä‘Æ°a ngÆ°á»i nghe Ä‘áº¿n chá»— tráº£ lá»i theo Ã½ ngÆ°á»i nÃ³i mong muá»‘n, báº¯t Ä‘áº§u báº±ng Don't you think/agree...?

Trong hai vÃ­ dá»¥ sau cÃ¹ng, cÃ¢u há»i phá»§ Ä‘á»‹nh dÃ¹ng Ä‘á»ƒ chá»‰ chá»§ Ã½, niá»m tin, hoáº·c thÃ¡i Ä‘á»™ cá»§a ngÆ°á»i nÃ³i. NgÆ°á»i nghe cÃ³ thá»ƒ phÃ¡n Ä‘oÃ¡n Ä‘Æ°á»£c tá»« cÃ¢u há»i (hoáº·c cÃ³ láº½ lÃ  tá»« giá»ng nÃ³i) ngÆ°á»i nÃ³i muá»‘n há» pháº£i tráº£ lá»i nhÆ° tháº¿ nÃ o.

Lá»i cáº£m Æ¡n trong tiáº¿ng Anh (Pháº§n 5)

Trang trÆ°á»›c
Trang sau Â 

Lá»i cáº£m Æ¡n ai Ä‘Ã³ Ä‘Ã£ khen ngá»£i mÃ¬nh

Khi Ä‘Æ°á»£c ai Ä‘Ã³ khen ngá»£i, vÃ¬ lá»‹ch sá»± báº¡n nÃªn nÃ³i lá»i cáº£m Æ¡n. Tuy nhiÃªn, ngÆ°á»i nháº­n Ä‘Æ°á»£c lá»i cÃ¡m Æ¡n thÆ°á»ng sáº½ khÃ´ng Ä‘Ã¡p láº¡i báº±ng cÃ¢u You're welcome.

CÃ¡c Ä‘oáº¡n há»™i thoáº¡i dÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y minh há»a cÃ¡ch nÃ³i lá»i cáº£m Æ¡n ai Ä‘Ã³ Ä‘Ã£ khen ngá»£i mÃ¬nh.

1.
A:	That's a beautiful necklace you're wearing.
B:	Thanks. I got it in Mexico last summer.
(necklace: chuá»—i háº¡t)
2.
A:	What a gorgeous flower arrangement! It's really beautiful!
B:	That's nice of you to say so. I'm really glad you like it.
(gorgeous): tuyá»‡t Ä‘áº¹p
3.
A:	Would you sing some more, Christos? That last song was lovely!
B:	Thank you, Mrs. Jenkins. I'm glad you enjoyed it.
4.
A:	That kitchen dish was fantastic, Nahmood! You are a great cook!
B:	I appreciate the compliment, but I did have a lot of help from my sister!
(appreciate: cáº£m kÃ­ch
compliment: lá»i khen)
5.
A:	Yumi, you did a beautiful job decorating your home. It looks wonderful.
B:	Well, thank you for saying so, but I got a lot of help from others.

CÃ¡c bÃ i TÃ¬nh huá»‘ng tiáº¿ng Anh thÃ´ng dá»¥ng khÃ¡c:

  • CÃ¡ch chá»‰ Ä‘Æ°á»ng

  • CÃ¡ch hÆ°á»›ng dáº«n

  • Lá»i cáº£m Æ¡n Ä‘Ã£ hÆ°á»›ng dáº«n

  • Cáº£m Æ¡n Ä‘Ã£ má»i

Lá»i giá»›i thiá»‡u trong giao tiáº¿p tiáº¿ng Anh

Trang trÆ°á»›c
Trang sau Â 

TrÆ°á»›c háº¿t chÃºng ta cÃ¹ng tÃ¬m hiá»ƒu cÃ¡c cÃ¢u tiáº¿ng Anh thÃ´ng dá»¥ng vÃ  cÃ¡c cÃ¡ch thá»©c Ä‘á»ƒ giá»›i thiá»‡u má»™t ngÆ°á»i thÃ´ng qua ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c.

A. Giá»›i thiá»‡u thÃ´ng qua ngÆ°á»i thá»© ba trong giao tiáº¿p tiáº¿ng Anh

Trong loáº¡i nÃ y, ngÆ°á»i thá»© ba lÃ  C quen biáº¿t cáº£ A vÃ  B. C sáº½ giá»›i thiá»‡u A vá»›i B hoáº·c B vá»›i A. VÃ­ dá»¥, giáº£ sá»­ ráº±ng Paul vÃ  báº¡n cÃ¹ng phÃ²ng vá»›i anh ta lÃ  Christos cÃ¹ng cÃ³ máº·t theo dÃµi má»™t tráº­n Ä‘Ã¡ banh. Paul nhÃ¬n tháº¥y Bob, má»™t báº¡n cÅ© thá»i há»c trung há»c vÃ  má»i Bob Ä‘áº¿n. Paul biáº¿t cáº£ Christos vÃ  Bob nhÆ°ng Christos vÃ  Bob khÃ´ng quen biáº¿t nhau, vÃ¬ váº­y Paul sáº½ giá»›i thiá»‡u nhÆ° sau: 

Paul:     Bob, I'd like you to meet my roommate, Christos, Christos is from
Greece and is studying English as a second language before he starts undergraduate
school in architecture. I think you've heard me talk about Bob, Christos. He's a
good friend from highshool, and we played basketball together.
Christos: Oh, yes. Nice to meet you, Bob.
Bob:      Nice meeting you, Christos.
(dá»‹ch: Paul: Bob, mÃ¬nh giá»›i thiá»‡u báº¡n vá»›i báº¡n cÃ¹ng phÃ²ng cá»§a mÃ¬nh, Christos, Christos
Ä‘áº¿n tá»« Hy Láº¡p vÃ  Ä‘ang há»c tiáº¿ng Anh nhÆ° lÃ  ngÃ´n ngá»¯ thá»© hai trÆ°á»›c khi anh áº¥y báº¯t Ä‘áº§u
há»c Ä‘áº¡i há»c ngÃ nh kiáº¿n trÃºc. MÃ¬nh nghÄ© báº¡n Ä‘Ã£ nghe mÃ¬nh ká»ƒ vá» Bob, Christos. Anh áº¥y lÃ 
má»™t ngÆ°á»i báº¡n thÃ¢n cá»§a mÃ¬nh tá»« há»“i há»c cáº¥p hai, vÃ  chÃºng mÃ¬nh thÆ°á»ng chÆ¡i bÃ³ng rá»• cÃ¹ng nhau.)

LÆ°u Ã½ ráº±ng Paul khÃ´ng chá»‰ nÃ³i: "Bob, I'd like you to meet Christos. Christos, this is Bob." mÃ  cÃ²n cho Bob biáº¿t thÃªm má»™t Ã­t thÃ´ng tin vá» Christos vÃ  má»‘i liÃªn há»‡ giá»¯a anh ta vá»›i hai ngÆ°á»i Ä‘á»ƒ há» cÃ³ dá»‹p lÃ m quen vÃ  dá»… báº¯t chuyá»‡n hÆ¡n.

Trong cÃ¡c tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng giá»›i thiá»‡u cÃ³ tÃ­nh thÃ¢n máº­t, náº¿u giá»¯a hai ngÆ°á»i Ä‘Æ°á»£c giá»›i thiá»‡u khÃ´ng cÃ³ sá»± khÃ¡c biá»‡t vá» vá»‹ trÃ­, tuá»•i tÃ¡c thÃ¬ nhá»¯ng danh xÆ°ng trá»‹nh trá»ng nhÆ° Mr., Mrs., Miss, Ms., vÃ  tÃªn gia Ä‘Ã¬nh thÆ°á»ng khÃ´ng cáº§n dÃ¹ng Ä‘áº¿n. NgÆ°á»i Ä‘á»©ng ra giá»›i thiá»‡u cÃ³ thá»ƒ cho biáº¿t Ä‘áº§y Ä‘á»§ tÃªn há» cá»§a ngÆ°á»i Ä‘Æ°á»£c giá»›i thiá»‡u vÃ o lÃºc Ä‘áº§u (Ä‘á»ƒ phÃ¢n biá»‡t rÃµ), nhÆ°ng sau khi hai ngÆ°á»i Ä‘Æ°á»£c giá»›i thiá»‡u báº¯t chuyá»‡n vá»›i nhau, láº½ tá»± nhiÃªn há» thÆ°á»ng chá»‰ xÆ°ng hÃ´ vá»›i nhau báº±ng tÃªn. NhÆ° vÃ­ dá»¥ dÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y: 

Harriet: Kerry! Hi! I'd like you to meet my friend, Lee Jones. Lee, this is
Kerry Fields, an old friend from college.
Kerry:   Hi, Lee. It's nice to meet you.
Lee:     It's nice meeting you, too, Kerry.

NhÆ°ng vá»›i nhá»¯ng trÆ°á»ng há»£p trá»‹nh trá»ng, náº¿u cÃ³ sá»± khÃ¡c biá»‡t vá» tuá»•i tÃ¡c, Ä‘á»‹a vá»‹ xÃ£ há»™i, chá»©c vá»¥ giá»¯a hai ngÆ°á»i Ä‘Æ°á»£c giá»›i thiá»‡u, ngÆ°á»i Ä‘á»©ng ra giá»›i thiá»‡u cÃ³ thá»ƒ muá»‘n cung cáº¥p cÃ¡c thÃ´ng tin nÃ y (ká»ƒ cáº£ tÆ°á»›c vá»‹) trong lÃºc giá»›i thiá»‡u.

Lynne:        Dr. Jackson, I'd like to introduce you to my roommate, Sharon Harrison.
Sharon, this is Dr. Harold Jackson, my chemistry professor.
Dr. Jackson:  How do you do, Sharon. It's a pleasure to meet you.
(hoáº·c "Ms. Harrison" tÃ¹y thuá»™c vÃ o anh ta tá» ra trá»‹nh trá»ng nhÆ° tháº¿ nÃ o)
Sharon:       It's nice to meet you, too. Dr. Jackson.
(CÃ´ ta sáº½ khÃ´ng dÃ¹ng tÃªn (first name) cá»§a Ã´ng ta vÃ¬ Ä‘á»‹a vá»‹ vÃ  chá»©c vá»¥ cá»§a Ã´ng ta trá»«
khi Ã´ng ta Ä‘Ã²i há»i cÃ´ ta lÃ m tháº¿)
Chemistry Professor: GiÃ¡o sÆ° hÃ³a há»c

Trong háº§u háº¿t cÃ¡c trÆ°á»ng há»£p, báº¯t tay hay khÃ´ng lÃ  tÃ¹y báº¡n, nhÆ°ng ngÃ y nay thÆ°á»ng ngÆ°á»i ta sáº½ báº¯t tay vá»›i nhau khi Ä‘Æ°á»£c giá»›i thiá»‡u, Ä‘áº·c biá»‡t lÃ  trong nhá»¯ng khung cáº£nh giao tiáº¿p xÃ£ há»™i trang trá»ng hay trong kinh doanh. ThÃ´ng thÆ°á»ng khi gáº·p máº·t, sáº½ cÃ³ má»™t ngÆ°á»i giÆ¡ tay trÆ°á»›c cho ngÆ°á»i kia báº¯t hoáº·c Ä‘Ã´i lÃºc lÃ  cáº£ hai. Náº¿u báº¡n á»Ÿ vÃ o tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng Ä‘Ã³, má»™t cÃ¡i báº¯t tay tháº­t cháº·t vÃ  láº¯c nháº¹ lÃ  Ä‘á»§. NgÆ°á»i Má»¹ hay cÃ³ khuynh hÆ°á»›ng Ä‘Ã¡nh giÃ¡ vá» ngÆ°á»i khÃ¡c qua cÃ¡ch báº¯t tay. VÃ¬ váº­y khi báº¯t tay khÃ´ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c quÃ¡ há»i há»£t, nhÆ°ng cÅ©ng Ä‘á»«ng bÃ³p tay quÃ¡ cháº·t hay giá»¯ quÃ¡ lÃ¢u.

Sau Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t vÃ i cÃ¡ch má»Ÿ Ä‘áº§u tiÃªu biá»ƒu cá»§a cÃ¡ch giá»›i thiá»‡u qua ngÆ°á»i thá»© ba, Ä‘Æ°á»£c sáº¯p xáº¿p tá»« trá»‹nh trá»ng Ä‘áº¿n thÃ¢n máº­t. Láº½ Ä‘Æ°Æ¡ng nhiÃªn lÃ  báº¡n pháº£i cung cáº¥p má»™t Ã­t cÃ¡c thÃ´ng tin cáº§n thiáº¿t, má»™t vÃ i chi tiáº¿t vá» má»‘i quan há»‡ giá»¯a báº¡n vÃ  hai ngÆ°á»i sáº¯p Ä‘Æ°á»£c giá»›i thiá»‡u, nhá»¯ng Ä‘iá»ƒm chung giá»¯a há». 

- A, it's my pleasure to introduce you to B... (Trang trá»ng)
- A, I'd like to introduce you to B... (Trang trá»ng)
- A, let me introduce you to B...
- A, I'd like you to meet B...
- A, I don't believe you've ever met B...
- A, have you met B?...
- A, meet B. B, A... (ThÃ¢n máº­t)
- A, this is B. B, A... (ThÃ¢n máº­t)

ChÆ°Æ¡ng tiáº¿p theo mÃ¬nh sáº½ trÃ¬nh bÃ y cÃ¡c cÃ¢u thÃ´ng dá»¥ng Ä‘á»ƒ Ä‘Ã¡p láº¡i lá»i giá»›i thiá»‡u trong giao tiáº¿p tiáº¿ng Anh.

Gá»i nháº§m sá»‘ trong giao tiáº¿p tiáº¿ng Anh

Trang trÆ°á»›c
Trang sau Â 

Xá»­ lÃ½ tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng gá»i nháº§m sá»‘ trong giao tiáº¿p tiáº¿ng Anh

Náº¿u báº¡n gá»i sai sá»‘, Ä‘á»«ng tá» ra bá»‘i rá»‘i hay khÃ³ chá»‹u. Má»i ngÆ°á»i Ä‘á»u cÃ³ thá»ƒ nháº§m láº«n. ÄÃ¢y lÃ  má»™t vÃ i cÃ¢u Ä‘Æ¡n giáº£n Ä‘á»ƒ nÃ³i náº¿u báº¡n gá»i sai sá»‘:

- Oh, I'm sorry, I have the wrong number.
- Oh, I'm sorry, I guess I have the wrong number.
- Oh, I'm sorry, I must have the wrong number.
á»’, tÃ´i xin lá»—i, tÃ´i gá»i nháº§m sá»‘.
- Oh, I was trying to reach Mr___________ (cho tÃªn).
á»’, tÃ´i Ä‘ang muá»‘n gá»i cho ...
- Is this (012345)____ (cho sá»‘ Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i mÃ  báº¡n muá»‘n gá»i)?
ÄÃ¢y cÃ³ pháº£i lÃ  sá»‘ mÃ¡y ... ?
Sau Ä‘Ã³:
+ náº¿u lá»i Ä‘Ã¡p láº¡i lÃ  khÃ´ng, vÃ­ dá»¥ nhÆ° "No, it isn't"):
Oh, I'm sorry. I dialed the wrong number.
+ náº¿u lá»i Ä‘Ã¡p lÃ  pháº£i, vÃ­ dá»¥ nhÆ° "Yes, it is"):
I'm trying to reach ____ (cho tÃªn). Is he/she there?

Náº¿u báº¡n tráº£ lá»i Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i vÃ  ngÆ°á»i ta gá»i nháº§m sá»‘, Ä‘Æ¡n giáº£n nÃ³i:

- I'm sorry. You have the wrong number.
hoáº·c
- I'm sorry. There's no one here by that name. I think you dialed
the wrong number.

CÃ¡c bÃ i TÃ¬nh huá»‘ng tiáº¿ng Anh thÃ´ng dá»¥ng khÃ¡c:

  • Qui táº¯c chung khi gá»i Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i

  • CÃ¡ch gá»i Ä‘iá»‡n Ä‘áº¿n má»™t cÃ´ng ty

  • Chá» Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i

  • Gá»i nháº§m sá»‘

  • CÃ¡ch chÃ o há»i

  • Lá»i chÃ o

  • Lá»i Ä‘Ã¡p

  • Giá»›i thiá»‡u qua ngÆ°á»i thá»© ba

  • CÃ¡ch Ä‘Ã¡p láº¡i lá»i giá»›i thiá»‡u

  • Tá»± giá»›i thiá»‡u

Trang trÆ°á»›c
PDF
Trang sau Â 
BÃ i viáº¿t liÃªn quan

ChÃº Ã½: Link ráº¥t nhiá»u bÃ i há»c khÃ¡c liÃªn quan á»Ÿ menu bÃªn trÃ¡i

CÃ¡c loáº¡t bÃ i khÃ¡c:

  • CÃ¡c thÃ¬ trong tiáº¿ng Anh (English Tenses)

  • Äá»™ng tá»« khuyáº¿t thiáº¿u (Modal Verb)

  • CÃ¢u Ä‘iá»u kiá»‡n

  • CÃ¢u bá»‹ Ä‘á»™ng (Passive)

  • CÃ¢u tÆ°á»ng thuáº­t (Reported Speech)

ChÃ o táº¡m biá»‡t báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh (Pháº§n 4)

Xá»­ lÃ½ tÃ¬nh huá»‘ng khÃ³ xá»­ khi chÃ o táº¡m biá»‡t

Lá»i khen trong tiáº¿ng Anh: Lá»i khen diá»‡n máº¡o

ChÆ°Æ¡ng trÆ°á»›c chÃºng ta Ä‘Ã£ cÃ¹ng tÃ¬m hiá»ƒu cÃ¡ch Ä‘Ã¡p láº¡i lá»i khen báº±ng tiáº¿ng Anh. Trong pháº§n nÃ y, mÃ¬nh trÃ¬nh bÃ y cÃ¡ch Ä‘á»ƒ khen diá»‡n máº¡o cá»§a ai Ä‘Ã³.

Khen ngá»£i váº» Ä‘áº¹p, diá»‡n máº¡o

Má»™t ngÆ°á»i Ä‘Ã n Ã´ng cÃ³ thá»ƒ ca tá»¥ng ngÆ°á»i ná»¯ Ä‘áº¹p á»Ÿ Ä‘Ã´i máº¯t, mÃ¡i tÃ³c, ná»¥ cÆ°á»i, vÃ³c dÃ¡ng hoáº·c diá»‡n máº¡o. Tuy váº­y khen má»™t ngÆ°á»i phá»¥ ná»¯ vá» cÃ¡c bá»™ pháº­n tá»‘i ká»µ trÃªn cÆ¡ thá»ƒ lÃ  Ä‘iá»u khÃ´ng hay â€” trá»« trÆ°á»ng há»£p hai ngÆ°á»i cÃ³ quan há»‡ sÃ¢u Ä‘áº­m. Khi phá»¥ ná»¯ khen Ä‘Ã n Ã´ng cÅ©ng váº­y, thuá»ng lÃ  vá» vÃ³c dÃ¡ng bÃªn ngoÃ i â€” mÃ¡i tÃ³c Ä‘áº¹p, ná»¥ cÆ°á»i ná»“ng háº­u, lÃ n da rÃ¡m náº¯ng nhÆ°ng vá»›i cÃ¡c bá»™ pháº­n riÃªng tÆ° khÃ¡c thÃ¬ khÃ´ng nÃªn.

DÆ°á»›i Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t sá»‘ lá»i khen tiÃªu biá»ƒu vá» diá»‡n máº¡o bÃªn ngoÃ i vÃ  cÃ¡ch Ä‘Ã¡p láº¡i:

Barbara:  Thank you, Robert. That's a nice compliment.

I still need to lose another 5 or 6.
